Title: Financial Analyst - Remote
Job_Description:
Financial Analyst- Remote
Elite Line Services provides world class Maintenance Solutions under the umbrella of our parent company Daifuku, an international leader in the Manufacturing and Integration of Material Handling Equipment including conveyors, sorters, pickers and robotics.
We are looking for an experienced Financial Analyst to provide accounting and financial expertise to the account team and the customer.
The pay range for this position is $ 70,875.00 - $ 85,000.00 per hour; however, base pay offered may vary depending on job-related knowledge, skills, and experience. In addition to base pay other considerations include a variable incentive plan, and a range of medical, financial, tuition reimbursement, and/or other benefits, dependent on the position offered.
Benefits We Offer:
11 Company Paid Holidays
Low Cost Health, Dental, and Vision Start on Day One
Employer Paid Short/ Long Term Disability and Life Insurance
Paid Time Off
Paid Sick Leave
Parental Leave Benefits
4 % 401K Match
Duties include:
· Consolidate and analyze financial data taking into account company’s goals and financial standing
· Provide creative alternatives and recommendations to improve financial performance.
· Assemble and summarize data to structure sophisticated reports on financial status and risks
· Develop financial models, conduct benchmarking and process analysis
· Conduct business studies on past, future and comparative performance and develop forecast models
· Identify trends, advise company and recommend actions based on sound analysis
· Track and determine financial status by analyzing actual results in comparison with forecasts
· Reconcile transactions by comparing and correcting data
· Consults with management to guide and influence long term and strategic decision making within the broadest scope.
· Drives process improvement and policy development initiatives that impact finance and operations.
· Perform additional duties/assignments as may be required by management.

2. Proficient in spreadsheets, MS Office and financial software applications
3. Outstanding presentation, reporting and communication skills
Preferred Qualifications:

2. Proven knowledge of financial forecasting and diagnosis, corporate finance and information analysis
3. Technical Capacity.
4. Business Acumen.
5. Communication Proficiency.
6. Ethical Conduct.
7. Problem Solving/Analysis.
8. Strategic Thinking.

Title: FP&A Associate
Job_Description:
About us:
We're on a mission to fundamentally transform mental healthcare accessibility. Grow Therapy empowers therapists to launch and grow thriving insurance-accepting private practices. We're creating game-changing technology to build America's biggest behavioral healthcare group and ensure that anyone can afford quality mental healthcare. Following the mass increase in depression and anxiety, the need for accessibility is more important than ever.
To make our vision for mental healthcare a reality, we're building a team of entrepreneurs and mission-driven go-getters. Our founders come from Harvard Medical School, Stripe, and Blackstone, and are champions of balancing bold ambitions with a culture that promotes holistic well-being. Since launching in 2020, Grow has raised over $90M from top VCs and angel investors, including TCV, Transformation Capital, SignalFire, Village Global, CoFound, and leaders of Oscar, Nurx, Quartet, Airbnb, and Blackstone.
What You'll Be Doing:
We are looking for a FP&A Associate to help build the finance vertical of Grow Therapy. You will own various key workstreams such as maintaining our company model, owning state tax registrations/obligations, auditing spend to drive insights & opportunities, and tech-enabling our financial spend & reporting systems. You'll be part of a remote-friendly team reporting into Strategic Finance Manager and working closely with our CEO. Your responsibilities will include:
Manage communications with our accounting, tax, and compliance partners to increase internal financial visibility and improve current processes
Collaborate cross-functionally with department leads to assist with financial planning and analysis
Proactively seek cost saving initiatives and develop innovate ways to assess and track business performance
Prepare ad hoc financial and strategic analysis on projects with the executive team and department leads
Manage and track revenue and expense reporting by scrubbing payments and invoices on a recurring basis
Salary range: $95k-125k
You'll Be a Good Fit If:
1-4 years of finance experience in investment banking, accounting, startups, or other relevant finance roles
Highly analytical / quantitative with technical financial knowledge; Excellent in excel
Highly organized and thoughtful; has experience with managing multiple high velocity workstreams simultaneously
Ability to manage large sets of data and build reports to effectively communicate financial impacts with internal and external parties
Team-oriented and willing to do jump into ad hoc special projects in fast-paced environments
[Bonus] Proficient in SQL
If you don't meet every single requirement, but are still interested in the job, please apply. Nobody checks every box, and Grow believes the perfect candidate is more than just a resume.

Benefits
The chance to drive impact within the mental healthcare landscape from day one
Comprehensive health insurance plans, including dental and vision
Our dedication to mental health guides our culture. Wellness benefits include (but are not limited to):
Flexible working hours and location (remote OR in-office, your choice!)
Generous PTO
Company-wide winter break
Mental health mornings (2 hours each week)
Team meditation
Wellness Stipend
In-office lunch and biweekly remote lunch on us!
Continuous learning opportunities
Competitive salary
The opportunity to help build a rapidly scaling start-up organization by taking strong ownership of your work, mentorship, and our unbounded leadership opportunities

Title: Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
Hims & Hers Health, Inc. (better known as Hims & Hers) is a multi-specialty telehealth platform building a virtual front door to the healthcare system. We connect consumers to licensed healthcare professionals, enabling people to access high-quality medical care—from wherever is most convenient—for numerous conditions related to sexual health, hair care, mental health, skincare, primary care, and more.
With products and services available across all 50 states and Washington, D.C., Hims & Hers is on a mission to help the world feel great through the power of better health. We believe how you feel in your body and mind transforms how you show up in life. That's why we're building a future where nothing stands in the way of harnessing this power. We normalize health & wellness challenges—and innovate on their solutions—to make feeling happy and healthy easy to achieve. No two people are the same, so we provide access to personalized care designed for results. At our core, our mission is deeply personal—because we too are customers.
In January 2021, the company was listed on the NYSE and is traded under the ticker symbol "HIMS". To learn more about our brand and offerings, you can visit forhims.com and forhers.com.
About the Role:
Hims & Hers is looking to hire a Financial Analyst to join our finance organization. This role will be reporting to the Sr. Marketing Finance Manager and is remote-based. As a Financial Analyst, you will own and be responsible for category P&L management, financial planning, strategic finance, systems, decision support, and analysis for category-level revenue, marketing, and unit economics.
What You Will Do:
Deliver analyses that determine marketing spending, and capital allocation decisions, and ultimately drive future growth
Partner with cross-functional teams to set, manage, and optimize pricing across business lines
Build, maintain, and fully own the revenue and contribution margin forecasts for multiple business lines
Own LTV models and be the subject matter expert of the unit economics of your responsible business lines. Guide leadership's understanding and decision-making for the business
Create models and reporting that distill complex information into actionable business insights
Define KPIs and build and automate reporting around them
Assist with developing P&Ls for new products and determining their financial feasibility
Act as a trusted advisor to business leaders on cross-functional teams. You will develop and present your business leaders with the most current information, analysis, and insights to help them understand their short and long-term financial position
Perform ad-hoc projects, financial analyses, and presentations for executive management and the Board of Directors
Participate in the preparation and review of annual, quarterly, and monthly budgets
Minimum Requirements:
B.S. in Finance or Accounting, or equivalent experience
2+ years of experience in an FP&A or an investment, banking, and/or consulting role
Experience in healthcare/consumer banking group or at a high growth start-up/company preferred but not required
Experience with online subscription businesses and lifetime value concepts is a plus
Experience in Excel and love the challenge of bringing structure to complex unstructured problems
Strategic thinker who is intellectually curious
Nice to have:
Execute requests into finished deliverables with minimal direction required
Highly organized and detail-oriented, with the ability to multitask
An agile self-starter who thrives in an ever-changing work environment
The ability to manipulate large datasets is a must. Prior Sequel experience is a plus
We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you're excited about this role, but do not meet 100% of the qualifications listed above, we encourage you to apply.
Hims is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, orientation, national origin, age, disability, genetics or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law. Hims considers all qualified applicants in accordance with the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.
Outlined below is a reasonable estimate of H&H's compensation range for this role.
An estimate of the current salary range is $75,000 - $125,000. H&H also offers a comprehensive Total Rewards package that includes equity grants of restricted stock (RSU's) so that H&H employees own a piece of our company.
The actual amount will take into account a range of factors that are considered in making compensation decisions including but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, and location.
Consult with your Recruiter during any potential screening to determine a more targeted range based on the job-related factors. We don't ever want the pay range to act as a deterrent from you applying!

Title: Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
Investor Direct Funding is a business turnaround and financing company that combines required financing with a unique and proven “Exit Strategy”. This exit strategy prevents the client from getting trapped in high-interest loans, restores profit and cash flow, and returns the business to a bankable position. This is a fast-paced and energetic atmosphere, which works similarly to a triage environment. When our clients are up against the wall with unhappy banks, creditors or taxing authorities, there isn’t the luxury of time before the dam bursts and minutes count. Their financial numbers are key to determining the resolution to the problems.
Responsibilities:
Assess client company financial statements.
Analyze current and projected financial status.
Prepare financial reports and presentations.
Assist upper management with developing financial strategies for clients.
Analyze causes of low or no profitability in underperforming client companies.
Job Type: Part-time
Benefits:
Flexible schedule
Schedule:
Choose your own hours
Experience:
Accounting: 1 year (Preferred)
Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Preferred)

Title: Financial Analyst Entry Level (C)
Job_Description:
This is an excellent full-time, temporary opportunity with an interest or background in securities!

Our client, an NYC-based legal services firm, is seeking consultants to join their team for an upcoming remote financial review anticipated to begin immediately. The anticipated duration is 2 months, possibly longer, working 40 hours per week. Strong Analytical, Organizational and Data Management skills including working with Excel
Attention to detail
Can work independently in a fast-paced setting
Excellent communication skills

UC San Diego values equity, diversity, and inclusion. If you are interested in being part of our team, possess the needed licensure and certifications, and feel that you have most of the qualifications and/or transferable skills for a job opening, we strongly encourage you to apply.

For the safety and well-being of the entire university community, the University of California requires, with few exceptions, that all students, faculty and staff be vaccinated against the COVID-19 virus and influenza before they will be allowed on campus or in a facility or office. For more information visit: Flu Vaccine Mandate / COVID Vaccine Policy
UCSD Layoff from Career Appointment: Apply by 01/19/23 for consideration with preference for rehire. All layoff applicants should contact their Employment Advisor.
Special Selection Applicants: Apply by 01/31/23. Eligible Special Selection clients should contact their Disability Counselor for assistance.
Candidates hired into this position will have the ability to work remotely.
DESCRIPTION
The Altman Clinical and Translational Research Institute (ACTRI) an organized research unit at UCSD, was established to provide education, training and infrastructure for clinical research in the San Diego area. It encompasses four hospital systems, two universities and four biomedical research organizations. It receives partial funding from a Clinical and Translational Science Award (CTSA) from the NIH, National Center for Advancing Translational Science. The ACTRI functions under the direction of Gary S. Firestein, M.D., Senior Associate Vice Chancellor UC San Diego Health Sciences.
Under general supervision of the Director of Finance, the incumbent provides financial management, administration, leadership and reporting for the ACTRI and clinical research administration (e.g. Office of Coverage Analysis Administration, Office of Clinical Trials Administration, Office of IRB Administration, etc.). The incumbent resolves variances, identifies problems, formulates and makes recommendations in accordance with departmental, university, and agency regulations, either independently or through coordinating the efforts of finance team members. The Lead Finance Analyst serves as a trusted resource and subject matter expert for team members on finance, analysis, and fund management areas. They will be responsible for post-award research administration to include proposal submissions and grant management, working in industry-standard applications such as Kuali and Oracle Financial Cloud.
Acts as liaison with the Controller's office, Vice Chancellor Health Sciences Business Finance team, General Accounting, and other central departments for the acquisition and administration of research and operational funding. Provides sound fiscal advice, assists and guides faculty and department support staff. Works closely with the Principal Investigators (PIs)/ Department Managers in reviewing and monitoring the fiscal status of funding sources including and making recommendations and offering solutions to resolve fiscal matters. Prepare regular reports and proposal accurately.
Uses advanced professional concepts and organizational objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways. Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques, and evaluation criteria for obtaining results. Contacts are both internal and external to the department at all levels.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS
Advanced knowledge of finance policies, practices, and systems.
Ability to identify, collect, and analyze information from multiple sources.
Advanced ability to effectively present complex finance related information both verbally and in writing in a clear and concise manner.
In depth ability to use multiple spreadsheet and database software tools to gather information for specialized, complex financial analysis, fiscal management, and financial reports.
Effective interpersonal skills at all levels within the organization; advanced service orientation and critical thinking skills; and attention to detail. In depth ability to use organizational skills to multi-task in a high volume environment.
Ability to function as a member of a team.
Advanced knowledge and understanding of internal control practices and their impact on protecting University resources.
Demonstrated strong math skills and analytical capabilities.
PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS
Experience with pre- and post-award research administration in a higher-education environment.
Thorough knowledge working with proposal submissions and grant management, working in industry-standard applications such as Kuali and Oracle Financial Cloud.
SPECIAL CONDITIONS
Employment is subject to a criminal background check.
Pay Transparency Act
Annual Full Pay Range: $59,700 - $124,300 (will be prorated if the appointment percentage is less than 100%)
Hourly Equivalent: $28.59 - $59.53
Factors in determining the appropriate compensation for a role include experience, skills, knowledge, abilities, education, licensure and certifications, and other business and organizational needs. The Hiring Pay Scale referenced in the job posting is the budgeted salary or hourly range that the University reasonably expects to pay for this position. The Annual Full Pay Range may be broader than what the University anticipates to pay for this position, based on internal equity, budget, and collective bargaining agreements (when applicable).


Job offer is contingent on successful engagement in the UC COVID-19 Vaccination program (fully vaccinated with documented proof or approved exception/deferral).

If applicable, life-support certifications (BLS, NRP, ACLS, etc.) must include hands-on practice and in-person skills assessment; online-only certification is not acceptable.

UC San Diego Health Sciences is comprised of our School of Medicine, Skaggs School of Pharmacy and Pharmaceutical Sciences, The Herbert Wertheim School of Public Health and Human Longevity Science, and our Student Health and Well-Being Department. We have long been at the forefront of translational - or "bench-to-bedside" - research, transforming patient care through discovery and innovation leading to new drugs and technologies. Translational research is carried out every day in the hundreds of clinical trials of promising new therapies offered through UC San Diego Health, and in the drive of our researchers and clinician-scientists who are committed to having a significant impact on patient care. We invite you to join our team!

JOB SUMMARY
Assists with developing, analyzing, and conducting financial analyses to assess the viability of financial plans and programs, with some guidance. Helps develops financial statements, compensation analyses, financial packages, and presentations for various projects.
.

Conducts technical research on relevant topics. • Assembles data and compiles drafts, outlines and graphic materials for financial presentations. • Analyzes future trends and indicators in related areas of interest. • The responsibilities listed are a general overview of the position and additional duties may be assigned. Clearly states implications and potential next steps. Demonstrates an understanding of effective composition, such as having first line in a paragraph state the subject. • Financial Analysis (Novice): The process of evaluating businesses, projects, budgets, etc. to determine their performance, stability and profitability. • Problem Solving (Novice): Uses critical thinking and process improvement i.e. coaches and mentors development of problem statement, describes current state, identifies root causes, creates future state, coaches and mentors development of solutions and action plans with a sustainability plan. Applies appropriate tools to address issues. • Project Management (Novice): Planning, organizing, and managing resources to bring about the successful completion of specific project goals and objectives.

Title: Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
About Us:
CarePoint Health is one of New Jersey’s leading health care systems comprised of three long-standing and highly-regarded hospitals – Christ Hospital in Jersey City, Hoboken University Medical Center and Bayonne Medical Center. CarePoint united three area hospitals to provide 360-degree-coordinated care by integrating the medical facilities and physician networks associated with these institutions. With over 4,500 employees, CarePoint is the largest private employer in Hudson County, New Jersey and each year provides care to over 300,000 individuals.

CarePoint prides itself on its patient-focused approach to care delivery, with an emphasis on preventative medicine, health education, and disease management. Leveraging its vast network of physicians and healthcare experts, CarePoint is quickly becoming recognized as a leader in the broader healthcare landscape as it pioneers creative solutions to address urgent population health needs.
What You'll Be Doing:
The Financial Analyst:
Monitors and analyzes accounting allocation and spending data to determine financial resources required to develop budgets.
Tracks expenses, inventories, and budget balances. Measures actual performance against budget.
Prepares forecasting reports and trend analysis. Develops recommendations for budget allocations that conform with budgetary policies and limits.
Utilizes financial modeling and data analytics tools.
Any and all other duties as assigned
What We're Looking For:
The successful financial analyst will have at a minimum:
Bachelors Degree in accounting, finance, business or related
2 years previous experience in FP&A
Previous healthcare experience is preferred
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
strong skills in MS Office suite including advanced skills with Excel
Ability to get things done and work independently

What We Offer:
Competitive pay
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
401k with Company match
Generous paid time off
Paid Holidays
Tuition Reimbursement
Advancement and career development opportunities

Covid-19 and Influenza Vaccinations are a requirement for employment at CarePoint Health. Title: Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.
At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
Our industry is rapidly evolving, and we need courageous, quick thinkers who can shape the strategic decisions that lead our business forward. Whether it’s negotiating with some of our largest global partners or creating next year’s financial plan, you can influence both our day-to-day P&L and the future direction of the company. As part of the team, you can have the opportunity to learn and use the latest data tools and technologies and explore a range of roles to grow your career. Find your place in finance on #TeamAmex.
Finance provides opportunities to work in the following functional areas: Corporate Planning & Analysis, Global Commercial Services Finance, Global Consumer Services Group Finance, Global Merchant and Network Finance, Controllership, Global Treasury, Investor Relations, and Tax. Join our team, and you’ll be providing decision support and financial planning to one of these business units. We are looking for future finance colleagues who are motivated by working in a fast-paced environment, delivering results, and collaborating with partners across the Blue Box.
Key Responsibilities include:
Provide best-in-class financial analysis and decision support to the organization to achieve financial targets and inform strategy
Influence business partners with sound logic and comprehensive analyses like monthly financial forecasts, risk/opportunity assessments, etc.
Build and maintain relationships with key business partners and finance colleagues to deliver on results
Learn how to articulate decisions clearly and gain buy-in from stakeholders across the business by preparing and presenting key recommendations to senior management
Gather and analyze information from a wide array of sources; identify trends and articulate how those trends impact our businesses
Obtain a comprehensive understanding of the business and its needs
Hone analytical acumen, communication skills and the ability to tailor complex messages to the appropriate audience
Qualifications:
Solid financial, analytical, and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate large amounts of data from multiple sources, spot trends & generate meaningful insights to drive growth for our businesses
Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel and Power-point), knowledge of programming languages is a plus
A strong work-ethic and robust interpersonal skills, showcasing the ability to build trust-based relationships within the finance team and with business partners across locations / geographies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; including the ability to communicate financial results to non-finance partners
Highly motivated self-starter with intellectual curiosity and proven ability to manage and prioritize workload across multiple projects/issues to drive results while meeting critical deadlines
Flexible to quickly adjust around shifting priorities, multiple demands, ambiguity, and rapid change
Bachelor’s Degree in business, finance, or related field
Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:

Title: Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
JOB SUMMARY
The Senior Financial Analyst is a critical member of the team which will support the future growth of the overall business and harvesting. The business is focused on offering innovative solutions to our Utility customers and our end market customers. This role develops, coordinates, and facilitates the financial modelling of key projects including harvesting opportunities and new contracted supply opportunities. In addition, this role will provide support in developing strategies, presentations, and business papers for the communication of project opportunities to our Leadership Team and Board of Directors, as well as providing analytical support and tracking on the entire Growth Pipeline for the business.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Comply with company Safety Policies and Procedures
Development and explanation of financial models
The ability to work closely with all business functions
Contribute to the Monthly Growth Pipeline updates to the Executive Team
Development of standard costing for existing and future Harvesting plant operations
Provide monthly variance reporting for material harvesting operations
Monthly key metrics consolidation and proforma comparison
Assist with the preparation of strategy papers and presentations (both internal and external)
Assist with the preparation of the annual budget, capital budgeting, and strategic planning for harvesting
Focus on supporting profitability improvement plans for harvesting plant sites
Profitability analysis by plant site and by market
Conduct break even analysis, volume sensitive scenarios, and cost curves
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES
Advanced Microsoft Excel and PowerPoint skills required
Ability to prepare complex sensitivity analysis in Excel
Highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized
Ability to immediately learn and adapt to feedback

Articulate with excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to think through strategic decisions, highly driven and self-motivated

Ability to be a team player and work with various functions/units of the business
Ability to take constructive feedback

Five-Ten years of experience ideally with some analyst experience

Title: OCM Sr. Analyst (FP&A)
Job_Description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Insight Global's Medical Device Manufacturing client is looking to hire an OCM Consultant to join their growing organizational change management team. The OCM consultant will helping with a large financial transformation project effort that will affect the entire organization, and this person will be dedicated to the FP&A workstream. The OCM Consultant will be following the 7 tracks of change management and will be responsible for both strategy and execution. Change impact assessments have been completed, so this person will be responsible for executing on the activities that will be happening across the sub-projects within this FP&A workstream. They will be responsible for figuring out what needs to be communicated, identifying the audience, establishing the timeline, and engaging Corporate Communications. There wil be a daily "standup" as this is a high visibility, high priority project. This person will also be doing a stakeholder analysis and needs to be able to deal with challenging stakeholders without overwhelming them about the change. There is a lot of redundancy across the organization so the purpose of this transformation is to enhance financial structure and processes.
MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS
5+ years of change management experience
Experience working on a finance related project process STRONGLY preferred
Other experiences like organizational structure, IT or process optimization would also be sufficient
Able to work independently
Strong communication and organization skills
Bachelor's degree

DESIRED SKILLS

The ideal candidate will be responsible for providing financial insights and analysis to support decision-making, identifying, and monitoring key KPIs, developing financial models, leading budget and forecast for various departments. Identify and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure financial and operational performance

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to improve financial performance and support strategic initiatives

Demonstrated ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment

Strong attention to detail and organizational skills

Gastro Care Partners is the national partner for successful regional gastroenterology practices. We believe in the mantra “medicine is local.” Gastro Care Partners provides high-performing regional practices with the resources necessary to thrive in today’s dynamic healthcare landscape while maintaining their practices’ identities.
We are looking for a Financial Analyst in the Denver metro area, to join our fast paced, growing organization! Title: Financial Systems Analyst - Digital Finance (Remote)
Job_Description:
Position Purpose:
The Home Depot is able to offer virtual employment of this position in the following states: AL, AK, AZ, AR, DE, FL, GA, HI, ID, IL, IN, IA, KS, KY, LA, ME, MD, MA, MI, MN, MS, MO, MT, NE, NH, NJ, NM, NY, NC, ND, OH, OK, OR, PA, RI, SC, SD, TN, TX, UT, VT, VA, WA, WV, WI, WY
The Financial Systems Analyst is a part of the Digital Finance team that identifies, optimizes, and automates highly manual, repetitive processes throughout the Finance and Accounting organization. This role serves as a key member of the digital transformation and innovation life cycle to ensure effective solutions are identified and developed to improve processes and/or generate cost out within the business.
Work cross-functionally with internal stakeholder teams to identify, vet, and gather requirements for finance processes deemed candidates for automation
Partner with business teams to ensure that the As-Is process flow and any required access requests for completion are documented

Title: Financial Analyst - Hybrid (3 days/wk in office)
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Financial Analyst position plays an integral role within the Financial Planning & Analysis team. This individual will be responsible for compiling and analyzing financial information for the organization. This role will perform routine and ad hoc analysis to enable key stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Responsibilities/Qualifications:
The Financial Analyst is to adapt to a continually changing business environment and seek out collaborative solutions that continually improve the financial analysis, data and outcomes, and budget operations of the organization. In addition, this role will help provide financial analysis, forecasting and planning to ensure annual profit and revenue goals are achieved.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Supports management with financial analysis, forecasting and budgeting (80%)
Create and publish weekly, monthly, and annual reporting and variance analysis
Assists in the corporate planning and forecasting processes
Work with different departments to provide actionable reporting/analysis to improve results and understand gaps
A variety of value-added corporate ad-hoc analysis as well as analysis requested by Executive Management and other corporate departments
Perform other financial analyst responsibilities as assigned
Special projects as necessary
Perform various responsibilities in support of corporate insurance policies (20%)
Prepare various tasks in conjunction with other departments to ensure risk is mitigated
Perform annual insurance analysis for renewals
Manages claims management process across all insurance lines to avoid improper claim denials and ensure orderly administration of claims
Administer fleet management across the enterprise in partnership with other leaders
Perform other insurance responsibilities as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors’ degree (business, finance/accounting emphasis preferred)
1-3 years of financial analysis experience with budgeting, variance reporting and analysis
Detail oriented, accurate, flexible, and able to work in a dynamic team-centric environment
Results-driven and possesses strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as ability to prioritize tasks
Ability to build relationships cross-functionally to drive attainment of goals and objectives
Demonstrated ability to work independently and complete tasks in a timely manner
Experience with ERP systems and advanced Microsoft Excel skills
About Pet Supplies Plus:
Pet Supplies Plus is focused on making it easier to get better products for your pet. With 675+ locations in 41 states, the stores have a streamlined design making it easy to navigate a wide assortment of natural foods, hard goods and pet services. Friendly, knowledgeable staff get to know each pet and their owner by name and provide playful store experiences to remind them just how fun it is to own a pet. Pet Supplies Plus stores are large enough to house an incredible variety of food and equipment, yet small enough to still feel neighborly.

Pet Supplies Plus is ranked No. 20 overall in Entrepreneur Magazine's 2022 Franchise 500® list and is the Top Full-Service Pet Supplies Franchise for its exceptional performance in areas including financial strength and stability, growth rate and system size. For more information, please visit www.petsuppliesplus.com.

In addition to federal law requirements, the company complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. Title: Financial Analyst II
Job_Description:
Overview:
Compensation: $59,000 - $85,000 based on experience and credentials
Schedule: Monday through Friday 8:00 AM - 5:00 PM (flexible hybrid)
The Financial Analyst provides support and analysis for finance-related functions such as asset liability management, financial reporting, profitability analysis, investments, and liquidity analysis. This individual conducts a variety of financial analyses and forecasting to aid in the completion of credit union projects and product development. An ideal candidate demonstrates excellent analytical skills and a thorough understanding of asset liability management.

Suncoast Credit Union is consistently chosen as a Top Workplace because its employees genuinely # LOVEWORK! Employees flourish in an inclusive culture celebrating growth and prioritizing the community. Chartered in 1934, Suncoast has never furloughed any employees. To attract the highest quality candidates, Suncoast Credit Union offers a comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to:
* COMPETITIVE MARKET SALARIES * MEDICAL COVERAGE * PAID TIME OFF * 11 PAID HOLIDAYS * PARENTAL LEAVE * RETIREMENT PLANNING * DEGREE ASSISTANCE * BONUS OPTIONS * ACCESS TO OVER 4,000 GYMS * FREE IDENTITY THEFT PROTECTION * PAID VOLUNTEER HOURS * LEGAL ASSISTANCE * MENTAL HEALTH RESOURCES * EMPLOYEE LOAN DISCOUNTS *
Get the benefits you deserve from an organization that cares about your well-being, inside and outside the workplace. Join a team supporting a healthy body, healthy mind, and healthy work-life balance!
Responsibilities:
Conduct routine and non-routine financial analysis
Assist with operating budget preparation and reporting
Coordinate internal and external audit functions
Develop and maintain a variety of financial models and reports
Analyze and interpret credit union data for asset liability modeling and reporting including validating ALM assumptions
Act as the primary user of ALM software to review data related to financial performance and financial scenario analysis
Prepare and analyze ALM reports
Create monthly ALCO Package reports
Analyze the loan portfolio to discover the sources of trends by identifying strengths, weaknesses, opportunities, and threats
Present trends, opportunities, and issues to ALCO, and make recommendations for action
Monitor the cash position at the Federal Reserve, other financial institutions, ATMs, and branches.
Assist with monitoring liquidity risks
Develop and implement “report writer” reports
Collect data from the database by data mining
Prepare monthly investment portfolio analysis, reconciliations, and accounting entries
Develop reports such as liquidity reports for investment decision making
Communicate trends and results regarding ALM, credit analytics, and investments
Prepare minutes from quarterly assessment meetings regarding ALM results and credit analytic results
Support the preparation of Suncoast’s financial forecasts and budgets
Prepare and analyze profitability reports for branches and departments
Direct and organize the preparation of the annual operating budget
Maintain budget information in the accounting system
Review budget variances and report the results to management
Coordinate schedules, activities, and other necessary information for auditors and NCUA examiners pertaining to ALM or credit analytics
Coordinate quarterly meetings with third-party ALM vendors and maintain a collaborative relationship
Review and develop accounting policies and procedures
Recommend efficiency improvements or methods to strengthen controls
Maintain knowledge and understanding of current trends, laws, and issues affecting the area of expertise
Attend educational events to increase professional knowledge
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in accounting or finance
5+ years of accounting or financial analysis experience, preferably with a financial institution
Excellent understanding of ALM, including interest rate risk, model assumptions, and interpreting results
Experience with liquidity management, including evaluating liquidity risk exposure
Excellent analytical skills including root cause and trend analysis
Excellent knowledge of Excel, including pivot tables and v-lookups
Proficient in Microsoft Word and advanced knowledge of SQL
Ability to prioritize tasks by effectively managing competing and changing priorities to meet required deadlines
Accurate, detail-oriented, and organized with task management
Ability to analyze and resolve difficult and complex problems
Good knowledge and understanding of regulatory compliance necessary to successfully perform job responsibilities
Good written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills to interact effectively with members, staff, vendors, and government regulators
Ability to influence others regarding policies, practices, and procedures

Title: Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
Job Description:
At Warner Music Group, we’re a global collective of music makers and music lovers, tech innovators and inspired entrepreneurs, game-changing creatives and passionate team members. Here, we know that each talent makes our collective bolder and brighter. We are guided by four core principles that underpin everything we do across all our diverse businesses:
Music is Everything: Music is our passion, and we can never get enough. Tastes, trends, and tech will change, but great artists and songwriters will always be our driving force.
Global Growth, Local Expertise: Music is a global language. Through communication and collaboration, our success can come from anywhere and translate everywhere.
Innovation and Insight: Pushing the boundaries requires the best information and the boldest imagination. We use both to create the future.
Empowered by People: Like the artists we serve and the music they make, our differences make us stronger. This is a place where every talent can belong and build a career.
We remain committed to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion. We know it fosters a culture where you can truly belong, contribute, and grow. We encourage applications from people of any age, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, religion, ethnicity, disability, veteran status, and any other characteristic or identity.
Consider a career at WMG and get the best of both worlds – an innovative global music company that retains the creative spirit of a nimble independent.
Job Title: Financial Analyst
A little bit about our team:
The Finance team at Warner Records supports all aspects of financials for the record label including Marketing, A&R, Revenue, Overhead and Expense reporting. We’re a tight-knit team where you’ll gain experience from a variety of backgrounds and have exposure to many areas within Warner Records.
Your role:
As a Financial Analyst at Warner Records, you’ll be gaining Finance experience in a lively industry. You’ll work alongside multiple Finance team members managing Marketing and Overhead spending for the label. This will give you outstanding insight into various departments at Warner Records. You’ll also work closely alongside the Shared Services team forecasting expense for our Joint Ventures. Everyone on our team is given the opportunity to get involved in special projects and will have the chance to create a meaningful impact on the Warner Records business.
Here you’ll get to:
JOINT VENTURE FORECASTING:
Manage monthly close, forecast and annual budget schedules for JV expense
Review 3rd party statements and partner with the Participations team to ensure accuracy
Work closely with the Accounting team in Nashville on monthly close and review of balance sheet
OVERHEAD:
Handle budget, forecast, and actuals for each overhead category.
Write journal entries as needed
Work directly with the CFO to explain variances
MARKETING:
Support Finance Manager on Marketing spending and related activities
Assist with monitoring and tracking spending mid-month to ensure accurate budget targets are being met and not exceeded.
Maintain marketing files – add marketing pages for new budgets and update overall projects & department pages
Train users on Ariba / SAP. Understand system functions and capabilities to be able to get new users set up and learn the system
Month-end close processes – complete journal entries and reports for both department and Shared Services team.
About you:
You have a Bachelor’s degree in Finance or Accounting.
You have strong analytical skills, and are very proficient in systems and Excel.
The right person for this position must have the ability to meet deadlines and pay close attention to detail.
The position also requires someone who is highly organized with a strong ability to multi-task, a self-starter, but someone who takes direction and works well with change, and is a phenomenal teammate.
We’d love it if you also had:
Music or Entertainment Industry experience
Knowledge of SAP
A passion for music
About us:
As the home to 300 Elektra, Asylum, Atlantic, East West, FFRR, Fueled by Ramen, Nonesuch, Parlophone, Rhino, Roadrunner, Sire, Warner Records, Warner Classics, and several other of the world’s premier recording labels, Warner Music Group champions emerging artists and global superstars alike. And our renowned publishing company, Warner Chappell Music, represents genre-spanning songwriters and producers through a catalogue of more than one million copyrights worldwide. Redefining what it means to be a music company in the 21st century, our consumer brands include trend-setters like UPROXX, Songkick, HipHopDX, and EMP. We’re the home to WMX – the next generation services division that connects artists with fans and amplifies brands in creative, immersive, and engaging ways – and Alternative Distribution Alliance (ADA) – the ground-breaking global distribution company for independent artists and labels.
Together, we are Warner Music Group: Music With Vision & Voice.

Love this job and want to apply?
Click the “Apply” link at the top of the page, or apply directly with your LinkedIn. Applying with LinkedIn will import all of the information you put in your profile, but will still allow you to upload a resume and cover letter.
Don’t be discouraged if you don’t hear from us right away. We’re taking our time to review all resumes, and to find the best people for WMG.
Thanks for your interest in working for WMG. We love it here, and think you will, too.

Title: Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
Cisive continues to make significant advances in the employment screening industry and is always looking for the right people to take us further. Recognized as a national leader in quality of service, timely reporting, cost-effectiveness, state-of-the-art technology programs, and legal expertise in employee screening, Cisive serves many of the country’s leading corporations. Through our technology, Cisive is able to quickly respond to changing customer needs.
Our Finance team is growing, and we are looking for a Financial Analyst to join us. This role will provide essential support in the budgeting, forecasting, and reporting processes and lead various ad hoc analyses to provide actionable insights to senior management. The ideal candidate is an intellectually curious self-starter looking to leverage their strong analytical skills to make an immediate impact on the business. This role will report to the Senior Director, Finance and is fully remote (candidate can be based anywhere in the US).
Responsibilities:
Support the annual budgeting and quarterly forecasting processes
Prepare quarterly board presentations and monthly financial dashboards for both internal and external stakeholders
Partner with the accounting team on the monthly close process to ensure entries are booked timely and accurately
Participate in monthly business review meetings with department leaders
Provide analytical support to senior management on high priority strategic initiatives, including crafting thoughtful presentations that summarize key insights and takeaways
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance the efficiency of the organization.
Assist in reviewing various potential acquisition opportunities
Qualifications:
1-3 years of experience in FP&A, strategic finance, corporate development, consulting, investment banking, or accounting
Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, or a related field
Highly proficient in Microsoft Office, especially Excel and PowerPoint
Advanced financial modeling skills strongly preferred
Strong analytical skills – able to synthesize large quantities of data into actionable business insights
Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills.
Highly organized, with the ability to multi-task and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Enthusiastic self-starter that takes initiative and ownership of their role
Experience with NetSuite and Concur ERP platforms is a plus
Measurements of Success
Strong attention to detail and focus with ability to deliver key financial and operational metrics in a timely manner.
Ability to think outside the box when analyzing data to find relationships/correlations that could enhance business needs and productivity.
Provide and support improvements to processes to enhance the efficiency to the department.
Estimated Salary
$90K - $120K range
Base compensation is based on bona fide factors including geographic location and relevant experience.

Title: Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
You Lead the Way. We’ve Got Your Back.
With the right backing, people and businesses have the power to progress in incredible ways. When you join Team Amex, you become part of a global and diverse community of colleagues with an unwavering commitment to back our customers, communities and each other. Here, you’ll learn and grow as we help you create a career journey that’s unique and meaningful to you with benefits, programs, and flexibility that support you personally and professionally.
At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
Join Team Amex and let's lead the way together.
Our industry is rapidly evolving, and we need courageous, quick thinkers who can shape the strategic decisions that lead our business forward. Whether it’s negotiating with some of our largest global partners or creating next year’s financial plan, you can influence both our day-to-day P&L and the future direction of the company. As part of the team, you can have the opportunity to learn and use the latest data tools and technologies and explore a range of roles to grow your career. Find your place in finance on #TeamAmex.
Finance provides opportunities to work in the following functional areas: Corporate Planning & Analysis, Global Commercial Services Finance, Global Consumer Services Group Finance, Global Merchant and Network Finance, Controllership, Global Treasury, Investor Relations, and Tax. Join our team, and you’ll be providing decision support and financial planning to one of these business units. We are looking for future finance colleagues who are motivated by working in a fast-paced environment, delivering results, and collaborating with partners across the Blue Box.
Key Responsibilities include:
Provide best-in-class financial analysis and decision support to the organization to achieve financial targets and inform strategy
Influence business partners with sound logic and comprehensive analyses like monthly financial forecasts, risk/opportunity assessments, etc.
Build and maintain relationships with key business partners and finance colleagues to deliver on results
Learn how to articulate decisions clearly and gain buy-in from stakeholders across the business by preparing and presenting key recommendations to senior management
Gather and analyze information from a wide array of sources; identify trends and articulate how those trends impact our businesses
Obtain a comprehensive understanding of the business and its needs
Hone analytical acumen, communication skills and the ability to tailor complex messages to the appropriate audience
Qualifications:
Solid financial, analytical, and problem-solving skills with the ability to manipulate large amounts of data from multiple sources, spot trends & generate meaningful insights to drive growth for our businesses
Excellent working knowledge of Microsoft Office (Excel and Power-point), knowledge of programming languages is a plus
A strong work-ethic and robust interpersonal skills, showcasing the ability to build trust-based relationships within the finance team and with business partners across locations / geographies
Excellent written and verbal communication skills; including the ability to communicate financial results to non-finance partners
Highly motivated self-starter with intellectual curiosity and proven ability to manage and prioritize workload across multiple projects/issues to drive results while meeting critical deadlines
Flexible to quickly adjust around shifting priorities, multiple demands, ambiguity, and rapid change
Bachelor’s Degree in business, finance, or related field
Salary Range: $55,000.00 to $105,000.00 annually + bonus + benefits
The above represents the expected salary range for this job requisition. Ultimately, in determining your pay, we'll consider your location, experience, and other job-related factors.
We back our colleagues and their loved ones with benefits and programs that support their holistic well-being. That means we prioritize their physical, financial, and mental health through each stage of life. Benefits include:
Competitive base salaries
Bonus incentives
6% Company Match on retirement savings plan
Free financial coaching and financial well-being support
Comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life insurance, and disability benefits
Flexible work arrangements and schedules with hybrid and virtual options with Amex Flex
20+ weeks paid parental leave for all parents, regardless of gender, offered for pregnancy, adoption or surrogacy
Free access to global on-site wellness centers staffed with nurses and doctors (depending on location)
Free and confidential counseling support through our Healthy Minds program
Career development and training opportunities
For a full list of Team Amex benefits, visit our Colleague Benefits Site.
At American Express, you’ll be recognized for your contributions, leadership, and impact—every colleague has the opportunity to share in the company’s success. Together, we’ll win as a team, striving to uphold our company values and powerful backing promise to provide the world’s best customer experience every day. And we’ll do it with the utmost integrity, and in an environment where everyone is seen, heard and feels like they belong.
American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, age, or any other status protected by law.
We back our colleagues with the support they need to thrive, professionally and personally. That's why we have Amex Flex, our enterprise working model that provides greater flexibility to colleagues while ensuring we preserve the important aspects of our unique in-person culture. Depending on role and business needs, colleagues will either work onsite, in a hybrid model (combination of in-office and virtual days) or fully virtually.

Title: Financial Analyst II, Wireless
Job_Description:
Department Summary:
DISH is transforming the future of connectivity. We’re doing it by building the country’s first virtualized, standalone 5G wireless network from scratch. The foundation of a connected world, it’s a network free of the limitations of the past, and flexible enough to satisfy all the social, economic and transformative needs of the changing world.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
DISH Wireless is seeking a Financial Analyst II for a fast paced, highly technical business environment. The position involves budget development, budget to actual reporting and reconciliation, business case development, reconciliation of vendor accounts. This job offers opportunities to make significant contributions to the Technology Development team, since the business is growing and processes and procedures are developing. A successful candidate will be able to build successful relationships and provide financial oversight for a constantly evolving business.

Primary Responsibilities:
Prepare the annual budget and rolling forecasts
Analyze the monthly financial performance and support accounting month-end close activities
Build and maintain weekly and monthly models for key operational and financial performance metrics, including KPI scorecards
Create and deliver financial presentations to leadership with recommendations financial implications of proposed decisions
Conduct project reviews with financial oversight
Leverage understanding of financial modeling, and a hypothesis-based approach to identify, validate and quantify multi year agreements
Demonstrate aptitude for critical thinking in complex situations with the ability to synthesize ambiguous data into concrete results
Track future pending commitments
Produce clear, well-formatted reports that communicate a clear, compelling message for the business
Perform ad-hoc analysis related to cost-savings opportunities, capital expenditures, and other corporate initiatives
Acts as steward of financial accuracy and data integrity
Skills, Experience and Requirements:
Undergraduate degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics or related field
2+ years of experience in an accounting/finance environment, preferably in the telecom or tech industries
Advanced skills in MS Excel
Proficiency with financial tools (e.g., Smartview, Onestream)
Understanding of business financial and accounting concepts (Accruals, Reversal, GAAP principles, etc.)
Intellectual curiosity, outstanding problem solving and strong analytical skills with the ability to seek, organize, analyze, and draw valid conclusions with attention to detail and accuracy
Strong interpersonal skills, well-developed oral and written presentation skills, with the ability to summarize complex concepts into understandable and easy-to-follow presentation materials to communicate effectively with senior executives
Benefits:
We also offer versatile health perks, including flexible spending accounts, HSA, a 401(k) Plan with company match, ESPP, career opportunities, and a flexible time away plan; all benefits can be viewed here: DISH Benefits.

The base pay range shown is a guideline. Individual total compensation will vary based on factors such as qualifications, skill level, and competencies; compensation is based on the role's location and is subject to change based on work location. Candidates need to successfully complete a pre-employment screen, which may include a drug test and DMV check.
Salary Range: USD $57400.00 - $82000.00 / Year

Title: Financial Analyst - Hybrid (3 days/wk in office)
Job_Description:
Overview:
The Financial Analyst position plays an integral role within the Financial Planning & Analysis team. This individual will be responsible for compiling and analyzing financial information for the organization. This role will perform routine and ad hoc analysis to enable key stakeholders to make informed decisions.
Responsibilities/Qualifications:
The Financial Analyst is to adapt to a continually changing business environment and seek out collaborative solutions that continually improve the financial analysis, data and outcomes, and budget operations of the organization. In addition, this role will help provide financial analysis, forecasting and planning to ensure annual profit and revenue goals are achieved.

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES

Supports management with financial analysis, forecasting and budgeting (80%)
Create and publish weekly, monthly, and annual reporting and variance analysis
Assists in the corporate planning and forecasting processes
Work with different departments to provide actionable reporting/analysis to improve results and understand gaps
A variety of value-added corporate ad-hoc analysis as well as analysis requested by Executive Management and other corporate departments
Perform other financial analyst responsibilities as assigned
Special projects as necessary
Perform various responsibilities in support of corporate insurance policies (20%)
Prepare various tasks in conjunction with other departments to ensure risk is mitigated
Perform annual insurance analysis for renewals
Manages claims management process across all insurance lines to avoid improper claim denials and ensure orderly administration of claims
Administer fleet management across the enterprise in partnership with other leaders
Perform other insurance responsibilities as assigned

QUALIFICATIONS
Bachelors’ degree (business, finance/accounting emphasis preferred)
1-3 years of financial analysis experience with budgeting, variance reporting and analysis
Detail oriented, accurate, flexible, and able to work in a dynamic team-centric environment
Results-driven and possesses strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills as well as ability to prioritize tasks
Ability to build relationships cross-functionally to drive attainment of goals and objectives
Demonstrated ability to work independently and complete tasks in a timely manner
Experience with ERP systems and advanced Microsoft Excel skills
About Pet Supplies Plus:
Pet Supplies Plus is focused on making it easier to get better products for your pet. With 675+ locations in 41 states, the stores have a streamlined design making it easy to navigate a wide assortment of natural foods, hard goods and pet services. Friendly, knowledgeable staff get to know each pet and their owner by name and provide playful store experiences to remind them just how fun it is to own a pet. Pet Supplies Plus stores are large enough to house an incredible variety of food and equipment, yet small enough to still feel neighborly.

Pet Supplies Plus is ranked No. 20 overall in Entrepreneur Magazine's 2022 Franchise 500® list and is the Top Full-Service Pet Supplies Franchise for its exceptional performance in areas including financial strength and stability, growth rate and system size. For more information, please visit www.petsuppliesplus.com.

In addition to federal law requirements, the company complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment.

Title: Junior Financial Analyst
Job_Description:
Company Overview
Grounded in Wall Street and enabled by technology, Mirador combines powerful data science and deep financial expertise to provide best-of-breed financial reporting services for U/HNW investment portfolios. We are a firm in the Wealth Management industry that supports the performance-reporting requirements of Family Offices, Wealth and Asset Managers, and Foundations throughout the United States, Western Europe, and Latin America. We are expanding rapidly with new clients and offerings, and as such are staffing to meet the need. Our firm is at the intersection of finance and technology.
There's a difference between being a part of an industry and taking an active role in reimagining it. Our team is fundamentally changing one of the world's largest growing industries—financial reporting. Other companies may offer similar services, but we have no true competition. To learn more about the benefits of working for Mirador, please visit our website.
Position Overview
We seek diligent, detail-oriented professionals to join the team. You must be comfortable working in a dynamic, performance-driven, fast-paced environment, and committed to delivering a high-quality, accurate product on a time-sensitive basis.

Liaise with team lead on system & data issues

Well-organized and self-motivated
Highly attentive to detail and accuracy
Familiarity with handling confidential data

Familiarity with financial services helpful
Associates degree in finance, business administration, or accounting
Competitive compensation based on qualifications.
