Title: Loan Officer
Job_Description:
Lendbuzz is a fintech venture based in downtown Boston. We are a diverse team in gender, nationalities, and cultures, speaking eight languages and representing six countries. We are incredibly passionate about the problem we're solving, the clients we're helping, and the exciting future of our company.

Help make this rocket ship go further and faster!

This position will report directly to the VP of Sales, and will work cross-functionally with the sales, operations, and finance teams. The job will involve analyzing, assessing, and approving loan applications based on a number of criteria and factors.
Responsibilities
Conduct independent risk analyses and assessments of loan applications
Support VP of Sales in reviewing loan application exception decisions
Assist Sales and Operations in evaluating the effectiveness of credit processes and guidelines, identifying gaps, and recommending improvements and changes as appropriate
Act as subject matter expert/contact point for assigned business areas
Identify material credit concerns
Consult with various stakeholders - including business management, Credit Risk, Operations and Finance – to ensure a comprehensive evaluation
Complete loan contracts and educate clients on policies and regulations.
Interview applicants to define financial eligibility and establish debt payment plans.
Prepare detailed loan proposals.
Reject loan applications and explain deficiencies to applicants.
Respond to applicants’ questions and resolve any loan-related issues.
Operate in compliance with laws and regulations.
Exercise discretion and independent judgement.
Perform of office or non-manual work directly related to the general business operations of the customers.
Experience/Abilities
1-3 years of experience within a financial services organization, focused on credit and/or risk management
Excellent interpersonal, communication, organizational and writing skills
Ability to develop business relationships with senior management and others throughout the organization
Equivalent to a B.S. degree in Business, Finance, or related field
We believe:

Diversity is a competitive advantage. We celebrate our differences, and are better when we have a variety of experiences, viewpoints, and backgrounds.

Compassion is a strength. We care about our customers and look to build long-term relationships with them.

Simplicity is a key feature. We work hard to make our forms and processes as painless and intuitive as possible.

Honesty and transparency are non negotiable. We incorporate these traits in all of our interactions.

Financial opportunity belongs to everyone. We work every day to improve lives by extending this opportunity.

If you believe these things too then we would love to hear from you!

Title: Mortgage Loan Officer
Job_Description:
Are you a proactive, big picture person who loves to use your power of influence to drive outcomes?
Are you comfortable with risk, taking action, and owning the results?
Are you impatient and always in a hurry?
Are you sick of bureaucracy and using rates as an excuse for not growing at the typical mortgage company?
If so, as a Mortgage Loan Officer for Dominion Financial Services, you will be empowered to drive outcomes through your ability to create relationships. We are looking to add talented members to our team who can enhance our current growth, and in return have a great compensation expected at $200k+.
Our primary business is the origination of mortgages for investors and investment companies. This is a business-to-business sales position, not business-to-consumer. About Company

At Dominion Financial Services we originate two main loan products – a short-term bridge loan for fix & flip investors, and a long-term rental loan for landlords growing their rental portfolios. DFS is thriving in the current competitive environment, and we continue to grow aggressively each quarter. Our current origination volume is $100MM per month with a team of just 10 loan officers.

While At Dominion You Will Enjoy

Title: Junior Mortgage Loan Officer
Job_Description:
Do you have a passion for helping others? O Bee is looking for great people who want to start building a career and making a difference in their communities. If this sounds like a great fit for you, apply now for our JR Mortgage Loan Officer position at O Bee Credit Union.
We are a community focused financial institution with a long history in the beer brewing industry. As the original Credit Union of the Olympia Brewery, we continue to embrace our brewery heritage in everything we do. Our sole purpose is to provide top-notch financial services to our members. We bolster this through our "People Helping People" philosophy which enables our team to give back in big and small ways to make our community a better place for everyone.
The Junior Mortgage Loan Officer contributes to the success of the Mortgage Loan Officer team by meeting standards of excellence in project management and marketing as well as providing analytical and administrative support. Take ownership of the mortgage loan process from application to funding, acting as project manager with minimal supervision. Work closely in-branch with assigned Mortgage Loan Officers compiling loan applications to ensure credit union and secondary market standards are being met and communicate recommendations if standards are not being met. Interact professionally with internal members, originators, processors, underwriters, real estate agents and outside organizations to obtain necessary documentation. Interact with members, mortgage loan officers, processors, underwriters, closers, title agents and real estate professionals in a collaborative and professional manner. They also do so much more! Check out the attached job description for an in-depth look!
The base salary + commission pay structure offers flexibility based on your needs, with a base range from $32,739 - $50,000 + commission, paid monthly. While you build your portfolio, you will receive a guaranteed salary for the first 4 months.
We have great benefits including employer paid medical, dental and vision and a contribution amount for dependents, wellness rewards of up to $300, 401(k) match, retirement pension, paid Holidays, vacation and sick time and tuition reimbursement. Plus, all employees are encouraged to volunteer for worthy causes within the local community. Whether it's at the local Humane Society, Food Bank, schools or many other events, we provide 20 hours of paid time per year to make this happen.
Applications submitted without a resume will not be considered. Recruitment will remain open until filled. Hourly salary is $22.16 to $36.24 depending on qualifications.
O Bee Credit Union provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran.

Title: Loan Officer (Trainee - Loan Officer)
Job_Description:
AgWest Farm Credit is a member-owned financial cooperative that provides financing and related services to farmers, ranchers, agribusinesses, commercial fishermen, timber producers, rural homeowners and crop insurance customers in a seven-state territory in the Western United States. AgWest is part of the 100+ year-old Farm Credit System – the leading provider of credit to American agriculture.
AgWest champions the growth and advancement of agriculture, the value of rural communities, and the vital contribution our customers make to the economy and society. We serve customers in 59 locations throughout the West.
We are in search of a Loan Officer (Trainee to Loan Officer) to join our Lending Department in Tulare, CA. This full-time position reports to the Senior Vice President and provides analysis and guidance on loans of various size and complexity to member-borrowers.
Compensation Information
The Base Salary for this position is $57,000 - $72,000. Position is eligible for an annual incentive program in addition to the base compensation.
Job Requirements
The Loan Officer (Trainee to Loan Officer) performs a variety of functions including, but not limited to:
Evaluate and analyze commercial and real estate loan applications and recommend loan approvals and denials
Responsible for exercising credit risk assessment and management on loans within area of responsibility
Conduct/complete complex credit analyses
Establish loan structure and terms, conditions and covenants, and collateral requirements consistent with the credit request and associated risks. Sets clear expectations with the customer
Assists senior-level credit officers with complex loan applications as necessary
Develop and maintain a significant professional presence throughout the assigned territory
Material participation in business development activities, originates new loans, pursue new credit relationships, and maintain/expand existing customer relations
Minimum Requirements
Bachelor’s degree in Agribusiness, Business, Accounting, Economics, or related field with 0 - 2 years of relevant work experience. Relevant experience may be substituted for education
Strong computer skills and experience with Microsoft Office suites
Ability to travel to perform certain required duties
Preferred Requirements
Agricultural lending experience preferred
Broad knowledge of credit and financing alternatives and the ability to analyze all components on standard and complex credits
Strong decision-making skills as well as strong interpersonal, communication, customer service and team skills
Effective problem-solving skills as well as effective negotiating, influencing, and marketing skills
Benefits Offered by AgWest
Medical, dental, and vision insurance
Basic term life and AD&D insurance (fully paid for by the company)
Paid time off (including vacation, sick leave, holidays, and volunteer time)
401(k) plan (6% match plus 3% employer contribution)
Employee Assistance Program
Wellness Program
Jeans are welcome at work every day at AgWest!
Details about insurance and retirement benefits are available at: https://www.farmcreditfoundations.com/fcfbenefits
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender orientation, national origin, marital status, age, disability, protected veteran status, or any other classification protected by law.
When you apply for a position with AgWest Farm Credit, we collect personal identifiers (from your resume and other application information you submit), such as your name, email address, mailing address, telephone number(s) and employment and education related information. This helps us evaluate job applicants for hiring opportunities, and, communicate with them.
To comply with federal regulations for equal employment opportunity and affirmative action (EEO/AA), we track our applicants by gender, race/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, and the position for which they applied. You will be presented with a voluntary self-identification form as part of this application; we wanted you to know why we collect this information and what we do with it. Please be aware that this information is kept separate from your application, and not utilized in the selection process.
For more information about the information AgWest Farm Credit collects, please see the AgWest Farm Credit California Privacy Policy.

Title: Loan Officer
Job_Description:
Loan Officer California
Looking for highly motivated, success-driven Loan Officers to live a designer lifestyle
Forget about transactions. Think platforms. Uber. Lyft. Airbnb. These 3 companies exemplify the new economy. The gig economy. You make money on demand. That's exactly what we are building here but better. With Uber and Lyft, there's wear and tear on your body and car. With us, there's no such thing. You can live in Finland or Timbucktu and still do this, work our platform. That's the beauty of it. Like Uber and Lyft, we provide leads. But it gets better. We also allow you to make residual income. Not so with Uber and Lyft and Airbnb. With us, you make money from your own efforts, the company's efforts, and the efforts of the other loan officers you refer and who become part of our company. With us, Money Works for You. Not vice versa and that's how it should be. That's how life should be lived. Working only 4 days a week and living your dream life. Moreover, you get to participate in our stock option when we go public in 2025. Interested? Apply now. We are looking ONLY for Motivated, committed, focused, coachable, impactful candidates. If this is you, we want you. Join Now.
We have received a ton of applications. However, at this moment, we are only recruiting LOs licensed in the state of California since we are only licensed in California, currently.

We have a proven system to follow. You follow it and you will be hyper-successful

We are gearing up to IPO by December 2025. We have leads and need more people. Are you coming with us?

Title: Mortgage Loan Consultant
Job_Description:
Overview:
Compensation: $53,000 - $78,000 based on experience and credentials
Schedule: Monday through Friday 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM (flexible hybrid)
Training is held onsite for the first 6 months
The Mortgage Loan Consultant serves as a member advocate for mortgage loan applicants originating through various channels. This individual maintains effective communication with members and other stakeholder parties to ensure timely decisions occur. An ideal candidate takes ownership to provide excellent member service according to Suncoast Credit Union’s mission, vision, and DNA statements.

Suncoast Credit Union is consistently chosen as a Top Workplace because its employees genuinely # LOVEWORK! Employees flourish in an inclusive culture celebrating growth and prioritizing the community. Chartered in 1934, Suncoast has never furloughed any employees. To attract the highest quality candidates, Suncoast Credit Union offers a comprehensive benefits package including, but not limited to:
* COMPETITIVE MARKET SALARIES * MEDICAL COVERAGE * PAID TIME OFF * 11 PAID HOLIDAYS * PARENTAL LEAVE * RETIREMENT PLANNING * DEGREE ASSISTANCE * BONUS OPTIONS * ACCESS TO OVER 4,000 GYMS * FREE IDENTITY THEFT PROTECTION * PAID VOLUNTEER HOURS * LEGAL ASSISTANCE * MENTAL HEALTH RESOURCES * EMPLOYEE LOAN DISCOUNTS *
Get the benefits you deserve from an organization that cares about your well-being, inside and outside the workplace. Join a team supporting a healthy body, healthy mind, and healthy work-life balance!
Responsibilities:
Interview members and record accurate information about the applicant(s) in the mortgage and consumer loan origination systems
Contact members regarding each mortgage file and in accordance with Suncoast service standards
Communicate with members to ensure the accuracy and integrity of submitted data
Analyze details and gather additional information necessary to ensure timely loan decisions
Ensure members’ understanding by answering questions, explaining preliminary documents and the next steps
Review and analyze all documentation to determine acceptability based on the portfolio or investor underwriting guidelines
Upload all documents to origination or Suncoast imaging system
Submit accurate applications with required supporting documentation to the underwriter
Recommend approval or denial decisions to the underwriter
Notify members of loan decisions by phone, electronic notification, or by mail
Prepare and mail approval or denial letters
Prepare and mail Regulation B letters advising members of additional information needed
Complete the Home Mortgage Disclosure Act for government monitoring information and record accurate data in origination systems for reporting purposes
Produce updated Loan Estimates based on qualified change of circumstances
Explain the content of the consumer mortgages preliminary disclosures, such as the term of the loan, rate, APR, closing costs, payment options, credit union paid closing costs, variable rate plans, and documentation requirements
Obtain the borrower’s Intent to Proceed before moving the file to processing
Utilize daily reports from the origination system to maintain the current status of assigned files
Maintain compliance with internal departmental policy and procedures regarding productivity and response time
Assist with reviewing tax returns and income verifications
Cross-sell Suncoast Credit Union products and services when applicable
Maintain knowledge and understanding of current mortgage products, regulatory compliance, and investor guidelines
Attend educational events to increase professional knowledge
Qualifications:
Bachelor’s degree in a business-related field, CCUE or PCUE designation preferred (A comparable combination of work experience and training may be substituted for education requirements)
4+ years of mortgage lending experience with a financial institution
Ability to prioritize tasks by effectively managing competing and changing priorities to meet required deadlines
Accurate, detail-oriented, and organized with task management
Good knowledge and understanding of regulatory compliance necessary to successfully perform job responsibilities such as TRID, HMDA, ECOA, FNMA, and PMI
Ability to analyze and resolve complex problems
Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills to interact effectively with members, staff, vendors, and government regulators
Ability to communicate policies, practices, and procedures
Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality

Safe Act Statement
This position requires the employee to register as a mortgage loan originator with the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System and Registry (NMLS). The employee will obtain a unique identifier from the registry before engaging in mortgage loan originator activities. The employee must maintain and renew the registration on an annual basis, provide updated registration information with the registry on a timely basis, and provide a unique identifier to consumers as required by applicable SAFE Act regulations and Suncoast Credit Union policies and procedures.

Title: Loan Review Officer
Job_Description:
SUMMARY

Performs reviews of bank's commercial loans to ensure compliance with established policies and standards. ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES include the following: • Evaluates quality of commercial loans and assigns risk rating indicating borrower's financial strength and probability of loan repayment.
Selects loans to evaluate for credit risk according to factors, such as geographical location, and type and amount of loan.:
Records data in software, such as purpose of loan, balance, collateral, and repayment terms.

Title: Junior Loan Officer
Job_Description:

The Junior Loan Officer is responsible for assisting the Loan Officer with originating, processing, and closing residential mortgage loans.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES, includes the following responsibilities, but not limited to:

Assists the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer in the collection and analysis of the Consumer’s financial information;

Reviews the loan application package taken by Senior Loan Officer for completeness and accuracy;
Under supervision of the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer, identifies any missing items from the loan application package which the processor may require when processing the loan application;
Under supervision of the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer, maintains regular contact with the Consumer, referral partners and CMG Mortgage between application and closing to apprise them of the status of the application and gather any additional information as needed; and
Under supervision of the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer, prepares any information requests, such as credit inquiries or address discrepancies, for review and signature by the Consumer.

Ability to work in a fast paced fluid environment
Proficient in Microsoft Suite, including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Good communication skills
The ability to handle multiple files in different stages of processing
Must be organized to keep track of inventory
High level of integrity and confidentiality required

Title: Loan Officer
Job_Description:
Are you interested in helping small businesses grow and thrive in a vital PNW industry? Washington Contract Loggers Association (WCLA) Credit Union is looking for a full-time Loan Officer to join its team in Olympia, WA.
Founded in 1984, WCLA Credit Union is a credit union for loggers and all persons and organizations engaged in forestry, timber, wood products, or related activities. We take pride in maintaining strong relationships with our members by delivering valuable financial services to meet the needs of the industry. WCLA Credit Union primarily finances forestry equipment, logging trucks, and other commercial purpose loans that support the forest products industry. WCLA CU is able to finance its loans through highly competitive deposit offerings. The Credit Union continues to grow in meeting the demand of its membership and is looking for an additional Loan Officer to join the team. This position will generally work in the office Monday through Friday, between the hours of 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m.

· Forestry equipment and related commercial loan originations.
· Consumer loan originations.
· Receive new loan inquiries and applications. Obtain, assemble, and organize required financial information in support of the application. Perform credit analysis and approve/recommend credits within delegated authority.
· Perform loan monitoring and servicing actions including periodic and annual loan reviews, completing monthly and quarterly reports, collateral inspection and valuations, partial release of collateral, and other routine servicing requests.
· Perform collection actions on delinquent accounts.
· Perform marketing and public relations functions on behalf of the credit union. Market and sell credit union products and services in support of the membership. Develop new business for the credit union.
· Perform other duties as assigned in support of the credit union.
A Good Fit Candidate will have the following qualifications:
· Two or Four-year degree, Advanced knowledge of MS Office Software
· Two years consumer / commercial / small business credit underwriting experience
· Knowledge of applicable laws and regulations
· Knowledge of timber industry and logging practices
· Credit union or other financial institution experience
This position is open until filled.
WCLA Credit Union offers full-time employees competitive benefits packages including medical, dental & vision insurance, paid vacation, sick leave and holidays, and 401k. Compensation is salary based, with opportunity to participate in the Employee Variable Pay bonus plan.

About Us...
Our $13 billion portfolio of customers, ranging from rural homeowners to global agriculture and food businesses, provides our employees with a unique opportunity to maintain a local presence while working for a top workplace. Our diverse business structure provides exciting opportunities for passionate, talented professionals in many areas. Additionally, many of our team members are highly respected in their area of expertise at both the state and national level making GreenStone one of the top Farm Credit associations in the country.

Major Responsibilities:
Combine agricultural and business knowledge with an in-depth understanding of each customer’s current financial position to provide innovative and workable alternatives to solve problems the customer faces in their ongoing farming operations.
Develop and maintain a significant professional presence throughout the local community.
Analyze directly (or with a Credit Analyst) moderately sized mortgage and commercial loan requests in a detailed, accurate, and timely manner.
Gather financial information and build customer relationships by listening to their needs, identifying latent needs, and providing solutions or alternatives.

Proven track record of prospecting new business and enhancing existing relationships is preferred.
Demonstrate interpersonal skills to successfully communicate both verbally and written.
Ability to work effectively on teams by building strong relationships, listening to others, valuing opinions, and helping team to meet goals.
Registration in the Nationwide Mortgage Licensing System & Registry (NMLS) will be completed upon extension and acceptance of employment offer.

Here's What We Can Offer You...

Salary commensurate with experience
15 vacation days, 12 sick days, and 12 paid holidays per year

Title: Junior Loan Officer
Job_Description:
POSITION OVERVIEW:
The Junior Loan Officer is responsible for assisting the Loan Officer with originating, processing, and closing residential mortgage loans.

ESSENTIAL DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES, includes the following responsibilities, but not limited to:

Assists the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer in the collection and analysis of the Consumer’s financial information;
Assists the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer in assessing the customer’s financial circumstances to determine whether the Consumer and the property qualify for a particular loan
Reviews the loan application package taken by Senior Loan Officer for completeness and accuracy;
Under supervision of the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer, identifies any missing items from the loan application package which the processor may require when processing the loan application;
Under supervision of the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer, maintains regular contact with the Consumer, referral partners and CMG Mortgage between application and closing to apprise them of the status of the application and gather any additional information as needed; and
Under supervision of the Loan Officer / Senior Loan Officer, prepares any information requests, such as credit inquiries or address discrepancies, for review and signature by the Consumer.
Employee will additionally utilize his/her knowledge, training and experience to solicit, originate and facilitate the processing and closing of loan products and financing of residential real estate transactions on behalf of the Company’s customers.

SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Direct Reports: N/A

Need to be able to multitask, assign priorities, and work under time constraints.
Heavy computer use.
Standard office environment, equipment and tasks, including work at a computer terminal.
This position requires partial sitting and walking throughout the day.
Employee must be open to work overtime to complete assigned tasks.

An active NMLS license required
Ability to work in a fast paced fluid environment
Proficient in Microsoft Suite, including Outlook, Word, Excel, and PowerPoint
Good communication skills
The ability to handle multiple files in different stages of processing
Must be organized to keep track of inventory
High level of integrity and confidentiality required

Title: Loan Officer Trainee
Job_Description:
Description/Job Summary
At FCS Financial, part of the nationwide Farm Credit System, we are looking for a Loan Officer Trainee to join our Team! FCS Financial is a member of the largest agriculture lending cooperative in the United States today. At FCS, we seek individuals who share passion for agriculture, rural living and helping people achieve their goals and dreams! FCS Financial is seeking an independent, competitive, pro-active individual looking to build relationships with new and existing customers! If you are looking for an opportunity to start your career in agricultural lending, this position is for you!
In the Loan Officer Trainee position, you will work closely with other Loan Officers to focus on marketing, originating and servicing agricultural financial products, and providing agricultural and financial expertise to customers and prospects while building strong relationships with these individuals! You are also able to combine your agricultural and business knowledge with an in-depth understanding of each customer's current needs in order to provide innovative and workable alternatives to solve problems the customer faces in their ongoing business operations. You will also cross train with different positions within the Association, such as the Sales, Credit, or Crop Insurance!
Don't miss out on this opportunity to take your lending career to the next level, apply now! FCS will help provide the tools and resources needed to learn!
Initial training locations for the Loan Officer Trainee position may include: Columbia, Higginsville, Macon, and Sedalia. (A permanent location will be identified after the trainee period is complete. Permanent location can be located within any of our branch office locations.)
This position is classified as Non-Exempt under the Fair Labor Standards Act.
This position is open until filled.
Department: Marketplace
Reports to: Vice President, Team Leader, Traditional/PT Farmer
Supervises: None
Responsibilities/Duties
Loan Eligibility
Meets with current and new customers to gather, update, and review financial and scope of operation information to determine eligibility
Completes the Farm Credit Services (FCS) application workbook in order to submit to the credit department
Marketing and Sales
Represents and promotes FCS Financial at agricultural organization meetings and events
Attends auctions and sale barns to promote FCS services and products
Determines appropriate sales approach for potential or current customers
Determines potential customer base and sales opportunities by prospecting and making cold calls
Communication
Contacts internal resources (credit, appraisal, crop insurance, customer service) to coordinate activities ensure customer needs are met
Contacts external resources (FSA, title companies, surveyors, legal counsel, appraisers, CPA's) to coordinate activities and ensure customer needs are met
Chattel and Collateral Valuations
Determines value of chattel (cattle, crops, machinery) and collateral (real estate) using external resources such as websites, local grain market, livestock facilities, and the internal appraisal manual for real estate
Training
Attends loan officer development training courses
Loan Closing
Determines location for loan closing and coordinates schedules to ensure loan closing time and location meets customer needs.
Other duties as assigned to meet the needs of the organization.
Scope of Responsibilities:
Responsibility

Measure

Portfolio Size

Up to $35M

Required Skills

Willing to relocate

Title: Mortgage Loan Officer
Job_Description:
NVR has been helping families build their happily ever after since 1948. As a Top 5 US homebuilder, we’re committed to quality and to our customers and we take pride in the nearly 500,000 new homes we have sold and built across the country. Working in the homebuilding industry is tangible and rewarding, but not every job at NVR requires a hard hat. We don’t just sell and build new homes; we also manage teams, acquire land, manufacture materials, provide mortgages to our customers, and provide corporate support to NVR’s multi-billion dollar business operations.
As a Mortgage Loan Officer, you will assume full responsibility to guide new home purchasers through the loan process from loan application to loan approval and settlement. You’ll prequalify prospective buyers, review financing options, and assist in repairing credit challenged purchasers as needed. You also serve as the primary point of contact for home buyers with NVR Mortgage throughout the home buying process.
This position is based on-site in our community model homes and our NVR mortgage offices.
Primary Responsibilities
Remain knowledgeable on all available loan programs offered by NVRM, as well as broker offerings, to compete with lenders to earn each customer’s business
Originate high quality loan applications and submit to the processing department along with all supporting documentation
Maintain weekly contact with all borrowers, brokers, NVR Mortgage branch personnel, and/or NVR Homebuilding partners to answer questions regarding specific loans, share loan status, and build relationships
Develop and maintain strong partnerships with the NVR Homebuilding Sales team to support the monthly sales goals of each community
Educate sales and marketing team members on industry changes and new product offerings
Provide excellent service to the builder and homebuyer while meeting yearly performance goals
Qualifications
Must meet National and State licensing requirements
At least 2 years of professional experience in conventional and government loans
Strong knowledge of FNMA, FHA, and State housing loans
Strong selling, customer service, and vocational skills
Four-year degree preferred
Life at NVR
At NVR, your desire to excel is matched by our commitment to your success and we’ll give you the tools and industry knowledge you need. Our management team is tenured and talented, nearly 80% of them promoted from within, so you’ll find mentors who can share their knowledge, provide career guidance and encourage your success.
NVR also offers benefits among the best in the industry that reflect the strong commitment we have to all of our employees.
Competitive Compensation
Home Purchase Discount
Mortgage and Settlement Services Discounts
Comprehensive Health, Life and Disability Insurance
401(k) (Full-time employees are eligible to contribute immediately)
Employee Stock Ownership Program
Vacation and Holidays
In addition to the traditional benefits, we offer all our employees stock ownership through a profit sharing trust as part of our retirement savings package. NVR has had the highest Earnings Per Share growth rate in the homebuilding industry for the past 10 years, so as we grow financially, so do you.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer.
Drug Testing and Credit Check are required.
Applicants must be legally entitled to work in the United States, as NVR does not provide visa sponsorships.

Title: Junior Tax Preparer
Job_Description:
Company Overview
Since 2003, Jade Associates, a Fiducial business, has been providing specialized accounting and tax services to French expatriates and entrepreneurs. Jade became a part of the Fiducial family in 2015. Fiducial, founded in France in 1970, is a major provider of financial services (Business Counseling, Bookkeeping, Payroll, and Tax Preparation & Advisory Services) to small businesses and their owners. As a trusted advisor to entrepreneurs, Fiducial provides the financial back office infrastructure to clients, allowing them to focus on what they do best: serve their customers.

Position Overview
Fiducial is looking for a Junior Tax Preparer for their Miami, FL office to support the Tax Managers.
The Junior Tax Preparer will work in a team environment and will be primarily responsible for preparing individual, corporate, and partnership tax returns as well as assisting in providing tax compliance, reporting, and researching. Knowledge of FBAR, 5471, and 8865 a plus.
Main Responsibilities:
Review financial statements and client documentation in order to prepare tax returns and associated forms and schedules
Inform clients of important paperwork and documentation needed to complete tax forms accurately
Upload client data and information in tax software
Prepare all related tax forms in accordance with policies, and in compliance with legislation and regulations
Follow up with software providers as necessary
Perform basic research, such as reading instructions for tax returns
Assist with tax audits by gathering data requested by tax authorities
Assist in following up with notices from tax authorities

Desired Skills/ Experience/Attributes
1+ years of experience in a CPA firm preferred.
1+ year of experience with tax preparation or 2 seasons of experience required.
Must be computer savvy, CCH Axcess experience a plus.

The ideal candidate for this position:
Has a positive attitude and an unrivaled ability to work with peers, staff, and senior management collaboratively
Has an entrepreneurial drive, is self-motivated, and driven to succeed
Has exceptional organizational and time management skills
Possesses a high level of integrity and respects quality assurance requirements.
Has a history of building relationships with clients and colleagues
Is committed to fostering and maintaining a service culture.

Education, Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field preferred

POSITION: Full-time Senior Bookkeeper
( Minimum of 40 hours/week )
If you are an awesome Senior Tax preparer with a minimum of 7 US TAX seasons experience, and looking for a long-term opportunity, then this role must be meant for you!
We are looking for:
Someone with a fun-loving, flexible, motivated, person who is detail-oriented. Someone who has a strong work ethic, confident, comforting in their communication with others, and can work with little to no supervision.
Experience and understanding of Insightly, and Slack is a plus but not required.
Must be proficient in Lacerte/Proconnect Online tax preparation software
Must be proficient in Quickbooks desktop and online version
Must be proficient in Excel
Must be willing to work with our teams all over the world, in different cultures, and
personalities
Must have a minimum of 7 to 10 years US tax experience (both business & personal
returns), have reviewed other staff work before for both technical and theoretical issues.
English language skills must be at a fluent level.
Key Roles and Responsibilities:
Communicate with the client via phone call and email
Preparing more complex tax returns (1040, 1120S, 1120, 1065)
Should know the tax documents (W2, 1099, Consolidated stmt, Settlement statement, Mortgage forms, HSA, Home office, Vehicle deductions, foreign credits, foreign filing requirements)
Can prepare WPS file (can arrange all these docs in proper order in PDF, know how to use tic tie, can present the WPs in a way to make it easy for a reviewer to review it, WPS should cover all necessary documents and research papers whether they are from the client or from his own research)
Overall knowledge of tax (what’s going on, recent changes, updates, carryback, NOL, the effect of business tax over personal taxes like K1, etc.)
Bookkeeping for tax basic knowledge is also required
Know the entire filing process (when to e-file, paper file, what to attach etc.)
Knowledge of other such returns like Gift tax return, Trust returns, State Franchise tax returns, such other returns as they come across (payroll returns are covered by the payroll department, and sales tax returns are covered by bookkeeping)
Reviewing tax preparation of our other staff (both for technical review and theoretical
review) & (returning to other preparers for review points & training)
Helping clients with documents, questions, issues
Bookkeeping review
Training less knowledgeable staff/answering staff questions
Tax projections & quarterly estimates
Communication with clients/government agencies / other staff
Special client projects as needed
Working as a team to help get information in, out, and done, and keep customers happy!
What you will get in this position:
To work with a global organization that focuses on tax minimization for USA company leaders
A fun, exciting, and engaging work environment
Job Stability. Our firm doesn’t run out of work. It means you will enjoy steady pay and a dependable workforce.
Paid Training. Training isn’t just necessary to our company, it is vital. We make sure that employees develop the skill-set that allows them to undertake a greater variety of work .
Spiff and bonuses. We provide a reward for every new idea you bring into the company to help streamline our processes.
Employee Referral Bonus Program. We provide a $200 incentive for every qualified candidate and stay with us for more than 90 days.
Equal Employment Opportunity. No company politics.
Employees are genuinely appreciated. Our company has a culture of appreciation. We don’t take for granted our people’s fantastic work.
Collaborative environment. We make sure that no one is left behind, and we actively support everyone’s career progress.
Permanent Work from home.
System requirements:
Minimum of 10mbps or higher
Minimum of i5 processor laptop or desktop
Minimum of 16GB Ram
Minimum of 512GB HDD or SSD
Headset with noise cancelation
Home-office setup with a quiet location
Working hours:
In our firm, the minimum requirement and non-negotiable is 40 hours a week, which may include possible weekend shifts, mandatory meetings, training, and events with staff and clients. During tax season, high fluctuation of hours (50 – 60 hours) is expected and you may be called upon to assist other teams when needed.
Must be willing to follow our hiring process:
Send your proposal along with your updated resume.
Answer the Critical thinking and Technical assessment through videoask
Behavioral and technical interview with HR
Meeting with department-head as the final interview
Hiring decision and job offer with Hr department head
Satisfactory Background and credit check
If you can confidently demonstrate that you meet the criteria above, please contact us as soon as possible. Ensure you put “super-badass-enthusiastic Job Role” in your title/cover letter/email submission or your submission will be ignored.

Job_Description:
Company name: Agro Accounting CPA
Title of position: Sign-off Tax Preparer
Position type: PT Independent Contractor, for Tax Season(s)
Pay range: $40-$50 /hr, commensurate with experience
Location: Fully Remote
Agro Accounting CPA is a modern, online fin-tech organization providing a range of tax services including but not limited to Tax Preparation, Accounting and Business Consulting, Sales & Payroll Tax, Bookkeeping, Company Formation & Tax ID Issuance, Tax Calculations, International Income Reporting, Audit Representation and Tax Relief Options. We specialize in working with Artists, Freelancers and Small businesses, and have been in business for 10+ years.
We are currently actively recruiting for 1-2 part time Tax Preparers to work with us on a remote and part time basis this tax season, through April 18th, 2023. If the relationship is a good fit, we hope to continue on a recurring, tax season basis.
Please note the ideal candidate will be a licensed Enrolled Agent or CPA based in the United States only.
This position will work approximately 15 hours each week and will require the tax preparer to be knowledgeable of legislation and regulations, provide excellent service to clients, and maintain the high standard set by the organization. As a result of our online fin-tech model, this position requires technological proficiency, with preferred experience working with Drake Tax, Google Sheets, and Google Drive/DropBox document sharing. This position will require the use of your own laptop or desktop computer and high-speed internet. Strong communication skills and ability to work in both a team environment and to work independently, remotely, is highly desired. A passion for working with freelancers and small businesses is preferred.
Description of responsibilities:
· Reviewing tax returns for clients by leveraging source documents provided by the client and work papers prepared by our staff. This includes understanding the client’s tax situation.
· Preparing and submitting tax outcome and open item emails to clients.
· Analyzing tax data submitted by the client and prepared by our staff, to maximize the outcome for the client.
Required experience: 5-7 years of relevant tax preparation work experience.
Required skills and certifications: CPA License of Enrolled Agent (Required), PTIN (Required), Work Authorization (Required)

For information on Agro Accounting CPA, including more information the services we provide and our company culture, visit our website at www.agroaccounting.com
Please note that due to the number of applicants for this position, we are unable to confirm and respond to each individual candidate. Those candidates selected for further consideration will be contacted as soon as possible.
Agro Accounting CPA is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

Although we pride ourselves on innovation, our corporate culture and vision are rooted in traditional values: hard work, honesty, diversity, responsible practices and absolute accountability to our partners and people. It’s a simple philosophy of embracing opportunity with optimism, and it’s made us what we are today.

Title: International Tax Preparer
Job_Description:
Company Overview
Since 2003, Jade Associates, a Fiducial business, has been providing specialized accounting and tax services to French expatriates and entrepreneurs. Jade became a part of the Fiducial family in 2015. Fiducial, founded in France in 1970, is a major provider of financial services (Business Counseling, Bookkeeping, Payroll, and Tax Preparation & Advisory Services) to small businesses and their owners. As a trusted advisor to entrepreneurs, Fiducial provides the financial back office infrastructure to clients, allowing them to focus on what they do best: serve their customers.
Position Overview
Fiducial is looking for a Tax Preparer for their New York, NY office.
The Tax Preparer will work in a team environment and will be primarily responsible for preparing individual, corporate, and partnership tax returns as well as assisting in providing tax compliance, reporting, and researching.
Main Responsibilities:
Review financial statements and client documentation in order to prepare tax returns and associated forms and schedules
Prepare tax returns for individuals, partnerships, and corporations
Prepare international tax forms such as 5471, 5472, 8865, 8833, 8938, and FBARs
Work on a variety of projects and for a variety of managers on a daily basis
Research basic tax issues for compliance purposes
Assist with tax audits
Assist in following up with notices from tax authorities
Salary - $75K
Desired Skills/ Experience/Attributes
2+ years of experience in a CPA firm
2+ years of experience with tax filing
Experience with international tax forms
Knowledge of CCHAxcess tax software is a plus
The ideal candidate for this position:
Has a positive attitude and an unrivaled ability to work collaboratively with peers, staff, and senior management.
Has exceptional organizational and time management skills
Possesses a high level of integrity and respects quality assurance requirements.
Has a history of building relationships with clients and colleagues
Has excellent attention to detail
Education, Certificates, Licenses, Registrations
Bachelor’s degree preferred
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: $75,000.00 per year
Schedule:
Monday to Friday

New York, NY: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)

Title: Teller - Breckenridge, CO
Job_Description:
Teller - Breckenridge, CO
- (067358)

What you’ll do
As part of Bank of the West, you’ll be making a positive impact on the environment, your community, and the planet at a leading sustainable bank.
We’re looking for a motivated and eager learner to fill the role of Teller. As the human face of the bank in customer interactions, you’ll be responsible for providing high-quality service by processing transactions efficiently and accurately. This is an entry-level role, and an opportunity to develop skills and experience to become a Universal Banker.
You will process customer transactions including deposits and withdrawals while following bank policies and procedures, as well as regulatory requirements. You’ll also help customers with branch technology and proactively educate them about digital self-service options. As a friendly and helpful branch presence, you’ll chat with customers to identify referral opportunities for appropriate bank products and services. You’ll meet individual goals that contribute to increased branch sales, revenues, and customer experience.

To protect the health and safety of our employees and customers, Bank of the West may require all U.S. employees to provide proof of their vaccination status, and employees who are not fully vaccinated may be required to undergo regular testing.

What you need
The desire to build your knowledge of bank deposits, services, and regulatory requirements
A personable nature and good customer service skills, both verbal and written
The ability to understand and explain digital tools—for example, how to enroll in online banking, how to pay bills online, and how to make remote deposits
The ability to build relationships and work collaboratively
Problem-solving skills
The ability to multitask effectively

What’s in it for you?
At Bank of the West, our people are having a positive impact on the world. We’re investing where we feel we can make the most impact, like advancing diversity and women entrepreneurship programs, financing for more small businesses, and promoting programs for sustainable energy. Bank of the West is now part of the BMO family, a leading North American bank with a 200+ year history of success. BMO offers abroad range of financial services to help customers achieve real financial progress and shares Bank of the West’s commitment in driving positive change for a thriving economy, a sustainable future, and an inclusive society.
We provide our team members with the resources they need to be successful at work, and to thrive outside the office. Whether it’s our healthcare benefits, a gym subsidy, parental leave, global opportunities, flexible working, or simply a pack of post-it notes, we make sure you have what you need.
Annual Hiring Range/Hourly Rate:
$20.00 - $20.50
Actual compensation offer to candidate may vary from posted hiring range based upon geographic location, work experience, education, and/or skill level.
Benefits: Visit https://www.bankofthewest.com/about-us/careers/benefits.html for benefits information.
Equal Employment Opportunity Policy
Bank of the West is an Equal Opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. Bank of the West is also an Affirmative Action employer - Minority / Female / Disabled / Veteran.
Bank of the West will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations.

Title: Full-Time Personal Banker II
Job_Description:
We will earn our customers' business every day, by being the very best at what we do.
FRANKLIN SAVINGS BANK
Functional Position Description
Personal Banker 2
Non-Exempt
Service Criteria
All individuals holding positions within Franklin Savings Bank are responsible for conducting themselves in a manner consistent with FSB’s Pledge of Excellence. The Pledge of Excellence describes standards of conduct that will be consistently demonstrated with customers and coworkers. These include Accuracy, Quality Service, Professionalism, Confidentiality, Teamwork, Respect, Timeliness, Innovation, Communications, and Enjoying the Journey. All employees are expected to be familiar with the descriptions of these standards and to understand the importance of consistently demonstrating them while performing their duties.
Purpose
Following the bank’s Mission and Vision, the goal of this position is to actively develop new business and expand existing customer relationships. The incumbent will assess and handle customers’ banking needs, obtain and process customer/account information and transactions, and sell bank deposit and loan products and services. The Personal Banker will actively refer customers to the appropriate area of the bank or its affiliate, Independence Financial Advisors (IFA). This position may include consumer loan origination and closing, account opening, safe deposit transactions, and branch opening/closing procedures. Incumbents are encouraged to actively engage in their own advancement and continued development of knowledge and job skills. Individual skill development will be supported through ongoing training and coaching by the manager.
This position is accountable to the Branch Manager.
Duties and Responsibilities
Responsible and accountable for representing the bank in a courteous, friendly, confidential, knowledgeable and professional manner to ensure that each customer’s experience exceeds expectations.
Responsible for providing prompt, efficient and accurate service in processing all transactions and service requests, whether in person or over the phone, to customers and co-workers.
Satisfactorily complete required compliance, regulatory and internal training.
Open new deposit accounts according to compliance policies. Accept consumer loan applications and complete arrangements for document signing and loan closings. Open and allow access to safe deposit boxes, update existing accounts and perform other deposit services such as direct deposit, wire transfers, stop payments, etc.
Consistently use all sales techniques, including exploring customers’ needs through the use of questioning skills and benefit statements to ensure a consistent and valued customer experience.
As a participant in the Retail Banking RoadMap Incentive Plan, must at a minimum, meet individual performance expectations which will contribute to the attainment of branch and department goals.
Meet or exceed individual goals for sales and referrals. Provide remarkable customer service through all customer interactions.
Comply with proper disclosure requirements, state and federal regulations, including but not limited to consumer privacy policies, CIP and Funds Availability.
By maintaining a general knowledge of services offered through IFA, identity referral opportunities to attain goals established for investment and insurance referrals.
Drive efforts in the branch to identify and implement a positive overall customer experience which will build customer loyalty and enhanced relationships.
Adhere to all operational controls, including legal, corporate, and regulatory policies and procedures to ensure the safety and security of customers and bank assets.
Deepen consumer and business customer relationships by effectively recommending bank products and services that meet financial needs.
Resolve account service issues and respond to customer inquiries promptly and effectively.
Responsible for buying and selling cash from the vault, ensuring cash drawer limits are not exceeded and drawer is locked when unattended.
Responsible for balancing cash drawer daily, adhering to balancing guidelines and retail performance guidelines.
Update customer relationship management systems with appropriate information.
Provide for the proper security of all non-public personal information (NPPI).
Responsible and accountable for maintaining knowledge of the bank’s products and services and can demonstrate proficiency in the use of our electronic delivery solutions.
Promotes team efforts in all areas.
May provide limited supervisory guidance to include system overrides, opening and closing of branch and check approvals.
Assist with the daily branch operations, including balancing of vaults, and ATM’s, coin machine maintenance, cash advance terminals and branch negotiables.
Adhere to all safety, security and soundness policies.
Properly identify customers to protect both the customer and the bank from loss.
Determine proper funds availability based on regulatory requirements and complete hold notices as needed.
Resolve account service issues and respond to customer inquiries promptly and effectively.
Receive checks and cash for deposit, verify amounts, examine checks and cash for validity, ensure all transactional documents are properly endorsed and/or signed.
Perform customer transactions including but not limited to the following:
Process deposits and withdrawals.
Accept loan payments.
Count and roll loose coin.
Issue bank checks and money orders.
Cash checks.
Perform credit card cash advances.
Process night and mail deposits.
*Note: The duties outlined are representative only and are not intended to include all possible assignments to this position or position classification. Additional duties may be assigned.
*
Working Conditions
Moderate physical effort and occasionally demanding work requiring dexterity, visual attention and application as needed for the operation of front-line computer terminals, drive-up windows, personal computers and various other types of office equipment.
Physical effort and lifting are required with the handling of materials and supplies, including the transport of coin and currency to and from the vault.
May be seated or standing for extended period of time with the freedom of movement on a regular basis.
Well lighted and ventilated office environment.
*External and internal applicants, as well as position incumbents who become disabled as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act, must be able to perform the essential functions (as listed) either unaided, or with the assistance of reasonable accommodations, to be determined by management on a case-by-case basis.
This job description represents an overview of the essential functions of this position. This is not a complete listing of all required duties. Specific duties may vary over time to meet the needs of the bank.
Franklin Savings Bank reserves the right to change the job duties as business requirements dictate. Employees will be expected to perform other reasonably related duties as may be required by Management.
Every employee works for Franklin Savings Bank, not just for a particular manager. Accordingly, employees are expected to act in the best interests of the bank, even if doing so requires actions and responsibilities not listed in the above job description.
Job descriptions are not intended as, and do not create, employment contracts. The bank maintains its status as an at-will employer.
Job Type: Full-time
Pay: From $17.45 per hour
Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Employee assistance program
Employee discount
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Health savings account
Life insurance
Paid time off
Referral program
Retirement plan
Tuition reimbursement
Vision insurance
Physical setting:
Office
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Day shift
Weekend availability

Manchester, NH 03102: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required)
Experience:
Cash handling: 1 year (Preferred)
Banking: 1 year (Preferred)
Customer service: 1 year (Preferred)

Title: Full-Time Bilingual Teller
Job_Description:
Description:
Bilingual Teller Role
** Must be fluent in speaking both English and Spanish languages**

To assist members and perform transactional duties by receiving or paying out funds with a high degree of accuracy while maintaining exceptional member service standards as set by Family Security Credit Union. Maintain accurate transactional records, providing basic cash receipt and payment services in accordance with credit union policies and procedures.

Bilingual Teller Major Duties and Responsibilities

Greet and welcome members to the credit union in a courteous, professional and timely manner, providing prompt, accurate, and efficient member transactions.
Receive checks and cash for deposit to accounts, verify amounts, and examine checks for proper endorsement.
Cash checks and process withdrawals after verification of member balances.
Process all mail which includes posting payments and deposits; sort and prepare items for branch shipment when applicable.
Maintain an up-to-date and comprehensive knowledge on all credit union products and services that are handled or promoted by tellers. Maintain an up-to-date and comprehensive knowledge on all related policies and procedures, rules and regulations, including robbery procedures.
Promote, explain, and cross-sell all credit union products and services.
Receive and process loan payments.
Balance cash drawer, research and resolve discrepancies and report any discrepancies to the Head Teller or Branch Manager.
Ensure the teller station is properly stocked with supplies to perform daily duties.
Check night depository and record proper information to process transactions according to credit union procedures.
Performs other related duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Bilingual Teller Qualifications
Required Qualifications:
High School Diploma or equivalent
Must be 18 years of age or older
Must be fluent in speaking both English and Spanish languages
Intermediate PC knowledge with basic Microsoft Office skills
One year of cashier or teller experience (experience must be within the past five years)
Preferred Qualifications:
Two years of cashier or teller experience (experience must be within the past five years)
Ability to comfortably read and write in both English and Spanish languages
Cash drawer balancing experience
Ability to work in a team environment
Excellent communication skills while using a pleasant tone and common conversational courtesies
Good interpersonal skills to include being courteous, diplomatic, and tactful
Ability to handle some daily lifting of boxed or bagged coins (weight will vary)
Good organizational skills
Ability to multitask when necessary
Bilingual Teller Expectations
Ability to sit or stand for extended periods of time
Ability to effectively move between frontline and drive-thru to ensure prompt service for all members
This job description is not a complete statement of all duties and responsibilities comprising this position.
Family Security is an Equal Opportunity Employer and will not discriminate or allow harassment against a person because of race, color, ethnicity, age, sex, gender, gender identity, religion, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability or condition, military or veteran status, genetic information or other protective status.

Title: Member Services Representative/Teller
Job_Description:
About us
Valley Isle Community Federal Credit Union is a full-service financial institution that offers services to all residents on the island of Maui. Our mission is to help our members' live better lives every single day. We are agile, fun, and member-centric.
We love our people! In fact, it is one of our core values. Generous benefits, a positive work environment, and a good work-life balance are all provided for our employees. Join our `ohana today!
Responsible for providing a variety of paying and receiving functions for members in person, via phone, and through the mail, including processing deposits, withdrawals, loan payments, cashiers’ checks, money orders, and cash advances. Balances each day’s transactions and verifies cash totals. Performs various member services functions such as opening and closing accounts, renewing certificates, and assisting members with bookkeeping and checking account problems. Answers members’ questions regarding Credit Union services provided and performs a variety of account maintenance duties. Actively cross-sells Credit Union services. Performs other tasks including various clerical and receptionist functions and assists other Member Service Representatives with duties as required. Serves members promptly and professionally.
Essential Functions and Responsibilities
1. Assumes responsibility for the efficient, effective, and accurate performance of teller functions.
a. Represents the Credit Union in a courteous and professional manner.
b. Receives share deposits and loan payments.
c. Processes cash advances, travelers’ checks, cashiers’ checks, money orders, bank-to-bank wires.
d. Disburses cash or check share withdrawals.
e. Processes transfers.
f. Verifies transactions. Monitors deposit amounts and examines documents for endorsement and negotiability. Detects and resolves discrepancies promptly.
g. Balances daily transactions and verifies cash totals. Investigates and resolves out-of-balance conditions.
2. Assumes responsibility for the effective and professional performances of member service functions.
a. Presents and explains Credit Union services and products to members and assists in meeting their financial needs. Opens and closes accounts. Orders checks for members’ accounts. Completes payroll deduction and authorization forms.
Answers questions and solves problems for members by listening to problems, collecting data, securing answers, and reporting results to the inquiring party.
a. Resolves member bookkeeping and checking account problems. Takes stop payment orders.
b. Receives and directs members and telephone calls. Responds to inquiries and questions or direct them as necessary. Records and relays messages.
c. Performs file maintenance and account changes as needed.
d. Keeps members informed of Credit Union services and policies, including types of available accounts, interest and dividend rates, payroll deduction options, and other related services.
e. Maintains and projects the Credit Union’s professional reputation. Maintains privacy of member account information.
f. Actively cross-sells Credit Union products and services.
2. Assumes responsibility for establishing and maintaining effective coordination and working relationships with co-workers and management.
a. Assists co-workers as required.
b. Keeps supervisor informed of area activities and of any significant problems or concerns.
c. Completes required reports and records accurately and promptly.
d. Attends meetings as required.
3. Assumes responsibility for related duties as required or assigned.
a. Ensures that work area is clean, secure, and well-maintained.
4. Comply with all State and Federal Regulations, the credit union’s approved policies and procedures as they relate to your job function, including Bank Secrecy Act ("BSA") Office of Foreign Assets Control (OFAC), and participate in all required training. Responsible for reporting any customer suspected of suspicious activity immediately to the BSA Officer.
Minimum Qualifications
Education/Certification: High school graduate or equivalent.
Required Knowledge: Knowledge of Teller and Member Service Representative operations and procedures. Basic understanding of Credit Union operations
Experience Required: No experience necessary. Abilities are generally acquired on the job in 12 months.
Skills/Abilities: Good communication skills. Professional appearance, dress, and attitude. Good math skills. Ability to operate related computer applications and other business equipment including adding machine, typewriter, copy machine, coin and money counting machines, and telephone. Good typing skills
Physical Activities and Requirements of this Position
Talking: Especially where one must frequently convey detailed or important instructions or ideas accurately, loudly, or quickly.
Average Hearing: Able to hear average or normal conversations and receive ordinary information.
Finger Dexterity: Using primarily just the fingers to make small movements such as typing, picking up small objects, or pinching fingers together.
Repetitive Motion: Movements frequently and regularly required using the wrists, hands, and/or fingers.
Average Visual Abilities: Average, ordinary visual acuity necessary to prepare or inspect documents or products or operate machinery.
Physical Strength: Sedentary work; sitting most of the time. Exerts up to 10 lbs. or force occasionally.
Working Conditions
None: No hazardous or significantly unpleasant environmental conditions.
Mental Activities and Requirements of this Position
Reasoning Ability: Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved instructions and to deal with problems involving a few variables.
Mathematics Ability: Ability to perform basic math skills and to use decimals to compute ratios and percentages and to draw and interpret graphs.
Language Ability: Ability to use passive vocabulary of 5 – 6,000 words; to read at a slow rate; define unfamiliar words in dictionaries for meaning, spelling and pronunciation.
Ability to write complex sentences, using proper punctuation, and use adjective and adverbs.
Ability to communicate in complex sentences; using normal word order with present and past tenses; using a good vocabulary.

Title: Bank Teller-Full Time with Benefits & Profit Sharing
Job_Description:
Are you looking for a full-time teller position working Monday-Friday, no evenings or weekends, no upselling and full benefit package including profit sharing? We are looking for someone who has cash handling experience and great customer service skills. If this is you, then we have a great opportunity available!
JOB FUNCTIONS:
The Teller performs customer service functions in line with established policies and procedures, provides a variety of service functions, including processing savings accounts, checking accounts, cashing checks, selling treasures checks, and accepting loan payments. The individual in this position processes mail and drop box deposits and is responsible for balancing each day's transactions and verifying cash totals.
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES AND DUTIES:
Represents the bank to the customer in a courteous, professional manner while providing prompt, efficient, and accurate service in processing transactions. Performs all teller-related functions following department guidelines.
Receives and processes all bank-by-mail deposits, drop box deposits, bulk cash deposits, night drop deposits, currency and coin orders, and excess currency and coin deposits for the Federal Reserve Bank.
Receives payments for commercial loans and receives and process all FICA tax deposits.
Gathers necessary data for account analysis, completing currency transaction reports, completing monetary instrument logs, mailing receipts and statements, ordering supplies and preparing vaults for opening and closing and verifying through logbook.
Balances all transactions such as treasurer’s checks and cash drawers at the end of the day.
Scans all work through the branch capture device and forwards work to the operations department. Ensures that batches are orderly and secure for transporting. Performs regular maintenance on equipment.
Orders treasurer’s checks for the facility.
Applies account holds on customer accounts as required by federal banking law.
Records all transactions for monthly management report.
Addresses customer inquiries and resolves problems.
Ensures that time locks are properly set, and alarms are tested monthly.
Other duties as assigned.
KNOWLEDGE AND MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:
Must be able to type 30 w.p.m. and be mathematically inclined.
Proficiency with ten key calculator and personal computer.
Must be mature, dependable, well-groomed, and customer service oriented.
High school diploma or equivalent required.
1 year cash handling experience.
ABOUT OUR COMPANY:
Founded in 1906, Cass Commercial Bank provides sophisticated financial exchange services to its parent company as well as its clients and consistently ranks among the top performing banks in the United States. Cass Commercial Bank, the wholly owned banking subsidiary of Cass, has provided banking products to faith-based and other non-profit entities since 1994. It has more than 250 faith-based and non-profit clients across the United States and has funded more than $1 billion of church expansion projects.

Title: Online Teller
Job_Description:
Overview:
Starting Pay : $18.50
The ITM Teller provides real-time transaction assistance to members from a centralized location through video transmission via the Interactive Teller Machine (ITM). This role performs a variety of financial transactions to serve Suncoast Credit Union members. An ideal candidate is comfortable, professional, and friendly on camera.

Monday through Friday: 10:00am – 8:00pm

Suncoast Credit Union is consistently chosen as a Top Workplace because its employees genuinely #LoveWork! * COMPETITIVE MARKET SALARIES * MEDICAL COVERAGE * PAID TIME OFF * PAID HOLIDAYS * PARENTAL LEAVE * RETIREMENT PLANNING * DEGREE ASSISTANCE * BONUS OPTIONS * ACCESS TO OVER 4,000 GYMS * FREE IDENTITY THEFT PROTECTION * PAID VOLUNTEER HOURS * LEGAL ASSISTANCE * MENTAL HEALTH RESOURCES * EMPLOYEE LOAN DISCOUNTS *

Process a variety of financial transactions including, but not limited to, deposits, payments, transfers, and withdrawals

Provide a high level of professional and courteous service while observing due diligence for the validity of the transactions

Good written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills to interact effectively with members, staff, vendors, and government regulators

Title: Remote Personal Banker - Remote
Job_Description:
Candidates must reside in Mountain Time Zone or Texas.

For over 87 years, we have worked to create trusting relationships with our fire family. The bonds we build are the foundation of our credit union. As the largest, exclusive firefighter credit union in the nation with $2.0B in assets, we serve over fifty thousand members in more than seven hundred fire departments.


Currently, we have an immediate opening for a Member Advisor to join our team to support Virtual Branch (Call/Contact Center). Utilizing our Service Enablers to be available, connect with the members, handle their requests, look out for them, and going above & beyond allows MAs to interact with members over the phone to Improve the Financial Lives of Our Fire Family.

Typical responsibilities:

Recommend FFCU financial products and services to members to meet individual member needs.
Process and manage member accounts and/or open new and sub-accounts.
Process, manage and decision consumer loan applications per consumer lending policies and underwriting guidelines.
Process and manage credit and debit cards.
Troubleshoot, research, respond, and provide training on member services technology and related issues.
Work with other employees and departments to ensure member requests are processed for investments, mortgages, business loans, and insurance.
Participate in special projects and perform other assignments as needed.
May occasionally travel to attend meetings, conferences, training, or other work-related events.

Basic Qualifications:

Experience in one or more of the following: technical support, sales, customer service, or banking.
Experience with consumer loan application processing.

Title: Deposit Operations Officer
Job_Description:
We are searching for a Deposit Operations Officer to join our team at our Corporate Office located in Macon, GA. Under the general direction of the Deposit Operations Manager, the employee is responsible for a variety of regular and recurring moderately to highly complex operational and accounting functions to support bank operations. The employee will need to comply with a bank policies and procedures, as well as with all applicable state and federal banking regulations.
Essential Functions
Handles are garnishment, levies and subpoenas.
Establish and maintain all Cash Management and RDC products, policies, procedures and forms.
Serves as a liaison with customers to install and maintain the RDC process and Cash Management ACH originations.
Manages Individual Retirement Accounts (IRAs) and Required Minimum Distributions (RMDs).
Trains all new Personal Bankers on IRA basics.
Process debit card disputes, work debit card fraud cases. provide debit card support and perform card maintenance.
Maintains CD rate changes on core system (Jack Henry SilverLake) and internal rate sheet.
Process all incoming and outgoing cash letter adjustments with the Federal Reserve Bank.
Complete daily exception processing of stop pay suspects, invalid/unposted DDA and G/L items.
Process NSF items, print NSF notices and mail.
Process daily ACH originations with merge from NetTeller and pre-origination with OFAC review.
Complete daily review of new stop payments placed on core system by retail staff.
Review all deposit related file maintenance performed by retail staff from Synergy reports.
Complete daily processing of ATM cash and check deposits.
Review all new account documentation for DDA account(s), Savings account(s), Safe Deposit Box(s), CD(s), and IRA(s).
Maintain new account and file maintenance exception log for retail staff.
Provide support to retail staff and be a point of contact for escalation of deposit operational issues.
Assist customers with Online Banking (NetTeller).
Complete daily reconciliations to include Official checks, correspondent Bank account(s), and ATM/Debit card(s), etc.
Maintain CDARS/ICS reporting and balancing.
Provide reports to management team as needed.
Update the Earning Credit Rate on core system (Jack Henry SilverLake) and internal analysis projections worksheet.
Process all required IOLTA remittance(s) and Federal Tax withholding(s).
Transmit deposit program totals for public funds on deposit.
Complete monthly reconciliation of internal DDA accounts, G/L accounts and branch debit card stock.
Remit Plus and Cirrus card totals.
Additional Responsibilities
Attends staff meetings as required.
Performs clerical tasks such as photocopying, filing and mailing various bank correspondences as needed.
Provides support to areas of the Bank, including the branches. loan operations, etc. as needed.
Performs other duties as assigned.
Required Education, Experience and Skills
High school diploma required. Bachelor's degree in business, finance or related field preferred. Will accept equivalent banking industry experience in lieu of Bachelor's degree.
Minimum of 5 years of banking experience with emphasis on deposit operations.
Thorough understanding of ACH transactions and NACHA guidelines.
Experience with Jack Henry products and/or Cognos is a plus.
Proficient in Microsoft Office applications including Word, Excel, and Teams.

The Commercial Deposit Coordinator reports to the Commercial Division Manager and is responsible for providing high quality service to commercial relationships. Closely adhere to the Bank's Information Security policies and procedures
Perform tasks that affect the Bank's compliance with federal and/or state regulations

Create a positive first impression and establish strong member relationships. Process basic and advanced member transactions. Assist members with account maintenance and problem resolution.
